loans.use: to buy cakes such as cinnamon pastries, bread pudding and doughnuts, as well as to purchase items such as embroidered and plain aprons.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, está soltera, tiene la edad de 32 años  y actualmente vive con su padres que son su mayor prioridad. Ella con el crédito va comprar los insumos para la asistencia de su plantación de café. Ella va comprar los abonos, plaguicidas y todo lo necesario para mantener su café en un buen estado de producción. Ella espera con esto poder darla su café una buena producción para las próximas cosechas y así poder sacar el máximo de ganancias para salir adelante con los pagos de su crédito. Ella espera poder mejorar su estabilidad económica para el futuro.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Juana is single, 32 years old and currently lives with her parents, who are her top priority.

With the loan she will buy supplies for her coffee plantation. She will buy manure, pesticides, and everything necessary to keep her coffee in a good state. She hopes that by this she will be able to have a good coffee production for the next harvests and so to make the maximum profit to get ahead with the payments for her loan. She hopes that she will be able to improve her economic stability for the future. 

This is her first loan from FUDECOSUR. She has not had loans from other banks before, but FUDECOSUR has offered her a loan with better facilities and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to attend to her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es: Don Mariano es originario de la ciudad de Boaco. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la compra y venta de CDs de música. Esta agradecido con KIVA y MiCrédito ya que ha podido invertir en su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias. Solicita el nuevo crédito para compra CDs musicales y lentes de sol. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda porque podrá incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Mariano is from the city of Boaco. He is a trader and buys and sells music CDs.

He is grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito because he could invest in his business and increase his income.

He is asking for a new loan to buy music CDs and sunglasses. He thinks that the loan will help him a lot because he will be able to increase his sales.

loans.use: to buy music CDs and sunglasses.

loans.name: La Esquina  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito La Esquina está conformado por 11 socias y 1 socio, quienes viven por la parroquia de Sinincay en Cuenca, este lugar tiene una hermosa iglesia, su gente son personas amables y gentiles que aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Laboran en diferentes actividades las mismas que les dan la oportunidad mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus hogares y sacar adelante a sus familias. Es un grupo muy unido que se apoyan en los momentos buenos y malos.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María, está realizando su primer crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito La Esquina, tiene 54 años de edad, es madre soltera de 7 hijos, tres de ellos ya son casados y viven independientes, sus hijos solteros están estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad, la casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña María se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y a las tareas del campo, cría cuyes y pollos, también se dedica a la agricultura y lo que cosecha es para la venta y para el consumo de su hogar. 
Su crédito va a invertir en la compra de cerdos para tener más animales. Su meta es crecer en la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
The "La Esquina" loan group has twelve members - eleven women and one man - who live in the Sinincay parish of Cuenca. There is a very beautiful church here. The people are very kind and friendly and are keeping up their towns' cultures and traditions. The group's members work in different types of businesses, allowing them to improve their household's financial security and helping them to prosper in their families. The "La Esquina" group is very close-knit and the members support each other during both the good and the bad times.

One member of the group is María, who is taking out her first loan alongside her friends and colleagues in the group. María is 54 years old and a single mother to seven children - three of them are now independent and live apart while the other children are all studying at a local school. María owns the house where she lives.

María does the housework at home and also raises guinea pigs and chickens. María also works in farming, growing crops both to sell and to consume at home.

María will invest this loan in buying pigs, so that she can have more animals. María's dream is to expand her business raising animals.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Blanca Noemy

texts.es:
Blanca de 42 años de edad.  Los estudio que realizo fueron hasta séptimo grado, ella está casada, su esposo esta fuera del país, él trabaja en la construcción y le ayuda a través de remesas para cubrir los gastos de la familia, ellos tienen cuatro hijos pero 3 de ellos ya no viven con ella, solo viven con una hija.
Blanca es propietaria de un taller de corte y confección (sastrería),  ya tiene como 15 años de dedicarse a desempeñar este trabajo, esto lo aprendió asistiendo a clases a un taller que realizaron el cual le llamo mucho la atención y fue así como lo aprendió y adquirió una máquina de coser y coloco su taller en su casa. Actualmente, lo tiene en su casa le ayudan 2 personas, su hija y una sobrina ya que ella confecciona los uniformes que el estado proporciona a los niños de la escuela de la comunidad.
El préstamo que está solicitando,  es para mejorar la vivienda en el área  de los servicios sanitarios, lo cual le permitirá tener más higiene en su casa atravez de la construcción de una fosa séptica.
El sueño de Blanca es hacer crecer su negocio, prestar su servicio a otras escuelas y dar empleo a más personas de la comunidad y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida ella y quienes le ayudan.
texts.en:
Blanca is 42 years old. She completed up to seventh grade at school. Blanca is married but her husband lives in another country - he works in construction and supports his wife by sending money home to cover family costs. The couple has four children, though three of the children have already left home. Blanca lives with just one daughter.

Blanca owns a dressmaking workshop. She has been doing this work for 15 years, having learned the trade at classes. She enjoyed the classes and learned the skills she needed and bought a sewing machine to set up in her house. Blanca now has two people who help her with the business - her daughter and a niece. Blanca produces the school uniforms that the state gives to children at the local school.

This loan will be used to improve the bathroom in her home. Blanca will install a septic tank, making her house more hygienic.

Blanca's dream is to expand her business and to offer her services to other schools and employ other people from the community. Blanca also dreams of having a higher quality of life and of having people who help her.

loans.use: to build a sceptic tank.

loans.name: Noé

texts.es:
Noé de 46 años de edad. Los estudios realizados fueron hasta el bachillerato con especialidad en el área de humanidades. Se encuentra casado, su esposa  realizo sus estudios hasta sexto grado. Actualmente, ella trabaja en una empresa atunera cumpliendo las funciones de limpieza de pescado. Ellos tienen 3 hijos, su hija tiene 21 años de edad, pero ya no vive con ellos, su otro hijo tiene 19 años de edad, pero él ya formo también su familia y vive a parte. Con ellos solo vive su hijo que tiene 15 años de edad, se encuentra estudiando bachillerato en el instituto nacional.
Noé es actualmente empleado de la alcaldía municipal, desempeñando el cargo de seguridad municipal, su jornada es de 24 horas, con 24 horas de descanso día por medio la distancia de su casa al lugar de trabajo es 25 minutos en el transporte público. El dinero lo necesita para construir una habitación para su hijo para que él se encuentre más cómodo, ya que actualmente le toca dormir en la sala. Los sueños de don Noé y su esposa es sacar a su hijo adelante, ayudarle a terminar sus estudios de bachillerato y pueda ingresar a la universidad para estudiar la carrera, para la cual él tenga vocación, ellos consideran que los estudios es la mejor herencia que le pueden otorgar.
texts.en:
Noé is 46 years old and completed high school with a speciality in humanities. Noé is married; his wife completed up to sixth grade at school. She now works for a tuna company cleaning the fish.

The couple has three children. They have one daughter, 21 years old, who has left home, and a 19-year-old son who already has his own family with whom he lives. The only child still remaining at home is the couple's 15-year-old son. He is currently in high school.

Noé works at the local town hall as a security guard. He works 24 hour shifts, with a 24 hour break after each shift. He arrives to work by public transport, a journey that takes 25 minutes. Noé needs this loan in order to build a bedroom for his son. He can then live more comfortably as he currently has to sleep in the living room.

Noé and his wife's dream is to help their son prosper. They want to help him to finish high school and enter university to study a profession. Noé and his wife believe that education is the best inheritance that they can leave their son.

loans.use: to build a bedroom for his son.

loans.name: Jose Roberto

texts.es: El señor Jose labora como guarda de seguridad, su esposa se dedica a las tareas del Hogar, su sueño es poder terminar de construir su casa el credito lo solicita para comprar materiales de construccion, Zinc, perlines y cemento ya que con lo que el puede va realizando las mejoras necesarias, Agradece la confianza y apoyo que Afodenic y Kiva le han brindado.
texts.en:
Jose works as a security guard. His wife takes care of the household chores. It is his dream to finish the construction of his house. He asks for a loan to buy construction materials: zinc sheets, beams, and cement, which he can use to make the necessary improvements.

He is thankful for the trust and support Kiva and Afodenic have given him.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: 14 De Agosto  (Gualaceo) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito 14 de Agosto está formado por 11 mujeres quienes viven por la comunidad de Zhidmad en el cantón de Gualaceo, este sector es hermoso por su geografía accidentada  la que brinda paisajes de ensueños, tiene un clima privilegiado ya que es templado apropiado para la cosecha de una gran variedad de frutas, siendo sus tierras muy fértiles. Su gente está formada por personas amables, gentiles, que tienen manos hábiles para realizar cualquier tipo de artesanías, las socias son mujeres muy amigas que tienen un objetivo en común el cual es que sus hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María, tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos, sus tres primeros hijos son casados y viven independientes, su hija soltera está estudiando en un colegio del sector, la casa en la que vive es propia, su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil.
Doña María se dedica a las tareas del campo, tiene ganado del cual vende la leche, cría cuyes, borregos y pollos. Cultiva su terreno y lo que cosecha es para el consumo de su hogar y si existe un sobrante lo vende, también se dedica a la venta de helados que ella mismo elabora. 
El dinero de su crédito es para la compra de abono para mejorar sus potreros, cuyes, pollos y  alimento para animales. Su meta es tener más ganado de mejor calidad
texts.en:
This "14 de Agosto" loan group has eleven members, all women, who live in the Zhidmad community in the Gualaceo community. This is a beautiful sector because of its geography and the dreamlike landscapes. The area has an excellent climate, just right for growing a great variety of fruits, and has very fertile land. The people here are friendly and kind, and have hands skilled for doing all sorts of artisan work. The members of the loan group are very good friends and share a common goal - to give their children a better quality of life.

One member of this group is 51-year-old María. She is married and has four children. The eldest three are married and live apart. The youngest daughter is attending the local school. The family owns the house where they live. María's husband works as a builder.

María makes a living working in the country. She has cattle, the milk from which she sells. She also raises guinea pigs, lambs and chickens. María grows crops for home consumption and, if there is any left over, to sell. In addition to this, María sells home-made ice cream.

This loan will buy used to buy manure, to improver her pastures, guinea pigs, chickens and animal feeds. María's goal is to have more cattle, and of a higher quality.

loans.use: to buy manure, guinea pigs, chickens and animal feed.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Evelyn is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling foodstuffs such as onions, gari, and rice in Kokoase (near Twifo Praso). Evelyn is married and has five children. Her husband works as a miner. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Evelyn wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of foodstuffs. In the long term, Evelyn plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of foodstuffs.

loans.name: Lucky

texts.en: Lucky sells household goods in her village of Kokoase near Twifo Praso. She has had some form of formal education as she is a junior high school graduate. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a miner. Lucky’s income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of household products, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a small store, hence helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of household products, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is married with three children. She has received schooling through fourth grade. Currently, Abena sells hair products in her village of Kokoase (near Twifo Praso). She has been involved in this industry for about ten years now. Her husband sells pharmaceuticals and they have three children. Abena’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. Abena will use the loan to increase her existing hair care capacity. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Abena plans to develop her business further by venturing into new markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing hair care capacity.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells salted and smoked fish in Kokoase (near Twifo Praso) and has been working in this enterprise for twenty-four years now. She has been educated through fourth grade. She is married and has five children. She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying the family's utility bills and their children's school fees. Her loan will be used to increase her current stock levels. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her fish enterprise and increase her capital base. In the long run Ekua wants to expand her business into neighboring villages.

loans.use: to increase her current stock levels.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is divorced and has three children. After successfully graduating junior high school, Joyce is now an established businesswoman. She sells smoked fish in her village of Kokoase near Twifo Praso. She has been actively involved in this business for about ten years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Joyce uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

She will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of fish to smoke, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Joyce plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of fish to smoke, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru: Гульнаре 39 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывает 2 сыновей. Гульнара с 2000 года занимается торговлей, до 2012 года торговала мужскими вещами, уже год как торгует детскими игрушками, стартовав с суммой в 50,000 сом (KGS), Гульнара сумела развить свой бизнес с ежемесячным доходом в сумме около 15,000 сом. В целях расширения ассортимента товаров, а именно на предстоящие новогодние праздники Гульнара запланировала расширение ассортимента товаров Гульнара обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом на покупку новых видов игрушек для розничной торговли. Гульнара уверена, что с расширением товара у нее появится возможность получения дополнительной прибыли. Часть полученных доходов Гульнара планирует вложить в ремонт дома, часть – в дальнейшее увеличение ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Gulnara is 39 years old and she is married with two sons.  She has been working as a shopkeeper since 2000.  Until 2012 she sold mensware, but for the last year she has been selling children's toys, starting with a sum of 50,000 som (KGS).  Gulnara has been able to increase her business to a monthly income of about 15,000 som.  With the goal of expanding her assortment of goods, especially with the upcoming New Year's holiday, Gulnara has turned to "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan to buy new types of toys for her retail business.  She is sure that by expanding her assortment of goods, she will have a chance to increase her income.  Gulnara plans to use part of this income to make repairs to her home, and the other part she plans to further increase her assortments of goods.

loans.use: to buy toys wholesale to sell at her stand

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa operates a bread selling business in Kokoase (near Twifo Praso). She is a single mother with one child. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Adwoa uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

She will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of bread, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. As a junior high school graduate, Adwoa understands the importance of education in improving social conditions, so she plans to use the profits from her expanded enterprise to ensure that all her children remain in school.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of bread, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay county. Homa Bay county is located in southwestern Kenya, and borders on Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing, and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. 

A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay county is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Mary is a widow with three children. She is a farmer.  She has been farming for fifty years and she is currently growing maize, beans, soya beans, ground nuts and sunflowers on her farm. She is excited about beekeeping as it will give her an opportunity to earn extra income and also provide her with honey for food.

This is Mary’s first loan with Honey Care and she intends to use the proceeds from her beekeeping to pay school fees for her grandchildren, who are orphans, and to provide their basic needs. Mary’s hope for the future is to invest more in her beekeeping project.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Plan Director - Cusco Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece  al banco comunal PLAN DIRECTOR - CUSCO; este banco está situado en el distrito de  Wanchaq en la provincia  de Cusco departamento de Cusco.

La socia Zenilda, la socia tiene 30 años de edad ,02 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de venta de computadoras, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende CPU, monitores, computadoras completas entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar impresoras.
Los otros socios se dedican a trabajar en turismo y los demás trabajan en instituciones públicas.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
La socia agradece este medio por el cual le facilita el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
Zenilda, who is 30 years old, is a member of the communal bank Plan Director – Cusco. This bank is located in the district of Wanchaq in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco. 

Zenilda has 2 children and lives with her partner. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling computers. She has been working in this business for some time, and it is going well for her thanks to the hard work she puts into her business every day. She sells CPUs, monitors, complete computers and other items. She is a responsible and diligent person and this is how she is able to bring up her family.

She is applying for the loan in order to buy printers.

The other members work in tourism or in public institutions. The person whose face is covered does not belong to the communal bank. The members whose photo has been attached to the group photo were given permission to arrive late to the meeting due to work reasons. 

Zenilda is grateful for this medium through which loans are facilitated, and is committed to meeting her payments.

loans.use: to buy printers.

loans.name: El Me Da La Mano Group

texts.es: El grupo lo forma tres socias muy luchadoras una de ellas es Avis de 39 años de edad, soltera, con dos hijos, su negocio es la venta de artesanía desde hace 3 años. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución año y medio. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de cerámica decorativas como lunas, soles estrellas, candelabros. Guillermina tiene 44 años su negocio es la venta de zapatos, Gricela de 49 años su negocio es una panaderia desde hace 15 años.
texts.en: The communal bank has three hard working members. Avis, 39, belongs to the group, is single, and has two children. She has been selling handicrafts for three years and has been a client of the institution for a year and a half. She will use this loan to buy decorative ceramic crafts like moons, suns, stars, and candelabras. Guillermina, 44, sells shoes. Gricela, 49, has owned a bakery for 15 years.

loans.use: to buy decorative ceramic crafts like moons, suns, stars, and candelabras.

loans.name: Urunboy

texts.ru: Урунбой жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте 42 лет. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Сотрудничает с Арванд с 2012 года и является добросовестным клиентом. Урунбой с юных лет занимается  животноводством.  Поначалу он помогал своему отцу развивать это дело, а теперь сам занимается этим бизнесом, чтобы приносить в семью доход. У него сейчас имеется несколько голов скота, и от этого бизнеса он получает хороший стабильный доход. Развивая скот Урунбой хочет увеличить доход семьи, построить коровник для своего скота, а также обеспечивать свою семью и удовлетворять все нужды такие, как пропитание, покупка одежды, школьных принадлежностей. Семья помогает Урунбою вести данный бизнес.  Жена  продаёт молоко, вместе с семьёй  занимаются земледелием и дети у него трудолюбивые присматривают за скотом. Сейчас Урунбой обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота для расширения своего бизнеса. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Urunboy is a cheerful and hard-working man.  He is 42 years old and married with three children.  He has been working with Arvand since 2012 and he is a good borrower.  Since he was young, Urunboy has been engaged in raising livestock.  At first, he helped his father with his animals, and now he himself has his own business which brings income to his family.  He has a few head of livestock and he earns a good stable income from this business.  By increasing his head of livestock, Urunboy wants to increase his family's income, buy a barn for his animals and take care of his family and provide for his family's needs, such as food, clothing and school items.  Urunboy's family helps him run his business.  His wife sells milk, the whole family helps around the farm and his children work hard looking after the animals.  Now Urunboy has turned to Arvand for a loan to buy livestock to increase his business.  He thanks Arvand in advance for their financial support.

loans.use: purchase of livestock

loans.name: Annie

texts.en: Please meet 29-year-old Annie from Liberia who lives in the community surrounding the town of Airport. She is single and has 4 children between 5 and 17 years old, who all live at home and attend school. For the past 8 years Annie has been selling fish. She started this business with money from her local saving accounts, and learned this way of selling from her friends. She sells from Monday to Saturday spending 8 hours each day on her business. She is appreciative of her business because she makes money. Her plan is to build a house. Annie is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. She would like to thank BRAC Liberia for their continued support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Please meet 40-year-old Josephine from Buchanan. She has three children, ages 6 months, 1, and 29 years old. Two children are in school and one lives in Monrovia with a relative. Josephine is not yet married to her fiancé.

Josephine owns a cook shop, where she sells rice and soup in the community market. She enjoys her business because she makes lots of money. She is requesting a loan to buy more food ingredients, such as fish, meat, oil, onion, pepper, and salt. She would also like to buy charcoal for her business. She hopes to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to buy more food ingredients and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline lives in Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay county. Homa Bay county is located in southwestern Kenya, close to both the Tanzanian border and Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake. Despite the proximity to the lake, water infrastructure in Homa Bay remains quite undeveloped, and inconsistent rains and occasional droughts make life difficult for farmers in the area. Nonetheless, farmers have adapted to these challenges, particularly by diversifying their crops to include cassava, sunflower, sorghum, bananas, groundnuts and millet, as well as drought-resistant varieties of papaya and mangoes. Although beekeeping has not traditionally been practiced in the region, many individuals have expressed interest in keeping bees and are knowledgeable about their pollination benefits. 

Evaline is married and has two children. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for five years and they are currently growing beans, watermelon, vegetables and tomatoes. She is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her extra income.

This is Evaline’s first loan with Honey Care. She intends to use the proceeds from her beekeeping to pay her children’s school fees and to provide for their basic needs. Her hope for the future is to expand her beehive project to produce more honey.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Selin

texts.en:
Selin lives in Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay county. Homa Bay county is located at the southwestern tip of Kenya, and its northern end is dominated by Lake Victoria, the largest lake in the Southern Hemisphere. Lake Victoria extends into three east African countries, allowing cross-border flows of goods and people, and a market day in a lakeside town in Homa Bay county often boasts traders from Uganda, Tanzania and Kenya, all of whom arrive in boats to ply their wares. Although the semi-arid nature of much of Homa Bay county means that poverty rates are quite high, many people in the region hold a strong cultural emphasis on education, and as a result school attendance figures around Homa Bay are above the national average. 

Selin is married and has six children. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for ten years now. They are currently growing millet, maize, beans, sunflower and watermelon on their farm. Selin is excited about keeping bees as it is an enterprise that is easy to manage and because it will generate her extra income.

This is Selin’s first loan with Honey Care. She likes working with Honey Care because it offers them an opportunity for development in beekeeping. She intends to use the proceeds from her beekeeping to pay school fees for the children. Selin’s hope for the future is to save up enough money to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: Orlando, de 47 años de edad, está casado con Neria y tiene 02 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Orlando es el dar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en un mototaxi que se compró con el fruto de sus ahorros más un crédito particular iniciándose de esa manera hace 12 años cuando se compró su primera unidad, y en el transcurso del tiempo fue renovando a otras unidades mientras se deterioraban por el uso cotidiano. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual poder solventar sus gastos familiares, además de ser su propio jefe. Por lo contario comenta que no le gusta cuando su mototaxi se malogra muy seguido pues le ocasiona muchos gastos, pero aun así logra ver buenas resultados, por eso tiene planes de crecer y poder comprarse un vehiculo de transporte de carga pesada. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/. 1000,  se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo para poder alcanzar sus objetivos. Con el monto solicitado comprará repuestos tales como llantas, aros, entre otros para tener su mototaxi en optimas condiciones.
texts.en:
Orlando, who is 47 years old, is married to Neria and they have 2 children who live with them in their own house. Orlando's business is providing a  passenger service in his mototaxi, which he bought using his savings and a private loan. Thus he started 12 years ago when he bought his first vehicle, and over time he renovated other vehicles when they deteriorated through daily use. 

Orlando likes his business as it enables him to have an income which he can use to cover his family expenses. He also likes being his own boss. On the other hand he says he does not like it when his mototaxi breaks down frequently as it costs him a lot. Despite this he gets good results and so he has plans to grow his business and buy a heavy goods vehicle. 

On this occasion he is asking for 1000 soles. He is grateful for the financial support he is getting to be able to reach his goals. He will use the sum requested to buy spares such as tyres, wheel rims and other items to keep his mototaxi in top condition.

loans.use: to buy spare parts such as tyres, wheel rims and other items.

loans.name: Angela 	Soledad

texts.es: Ángela Soledad Guevara es originaria de la ciudad de Chinandega. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Es una mujer emprendedora que ha logrado salir adelante y cumplir las metas propuestas. Solicita el crédito para comprar productos escolares como: Lápices, Cuadernos, Carpetas, Folders entre otros. Su meta próxima es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda y poder tener una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Ángela Soledad Guevara is from the city of Chinandega. She works in retail and has a grocery store. She is an enterprising woman who has managed to get on in life and achieve the goals she set herself.

She is asking for the loan to buy school items such as pencils, notebooks, files, folders and other items. Her next goal is to improve the infrastructure of her home and to be able to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy school items such as pencils, notebooks, files, folders and other items.

loans.name: Valentin Feliciano

texts.es:
Valentín tiene 58 años de edad estado civil soltero vive con la sobrina en la Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC SAN FRANCISCO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Pantano, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.
Valentín se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz.  Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes agrícolas y abono.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta para trabajar en el campo e invertir en los fertilizantes y poder progresar.

El sueño es comprar un carro y un terreno para transportar los productos para poder vender.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta  es la competencia  y el mal clima.
En el tiempo libre le gustar pasar con su familia.
texts.en:
Valentín is 58 years old and single. He lives with his niece in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.

He is a member of the communal bank San Francisco, which is located in the area of Pantano in the canton of Ventanas. The members make a living through agriculture and raising livestock.

Valentín works in agriculture, growing corn and rice. He is requesting this loan to purchase agricultural fertilizers and manure.

With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy what he needs for the work in the fields, invest in fertilizers, and thus be able to make progress.

His dream is to buy a car and a plot of land in order to transport products to sell. The challenges he faces are competition and bad weather. Valentín likes to spend his free time with his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers for planting corn.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio is a fisherman from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. He is a married man and has been in the fishing business for more than ten years.

As of now, Gregorio is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and coolers. With this, he will be able to improve his catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market.

In the future, Gregorio has hopes of making his business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and coolers

loans.name: Las Profesoras Group

texts.es: Este lo conforman tres socias de negocios una de ellas es Julieta tiene la edad de 52 años, casada, con un hijo, su negocio es un salón de belleza que tiene desde hace 12 años, además es directora de un centro escolar de Nindiri. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 1 año. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de productos como tintes, shampo profesional, rehabilitantes, pinturas, espuma, keratina. Yaneth tiene 63 años su negocio es la venta de bisutería y trabaja como docente, Elieth  tiene 35 años su negocio es la venta de ropa y trabaja como docente tambien.
texts.en: This group has three members. Julieta, 52, belongs to the group, is married, and has a son. She has owned a beauty salon for 12 years, and she is the director of a school center in Nindiri. She has been a client of the institution for a year. She will use the loan to buy products like dyes, professional shampoo, hair revitalizers, polishes, mousses, and keratin. Yaneth, 63, sells costume jewelry and is a teacher. Elieth, 35, sells clothing and also is a teacher.

loans.use: to buy products like dyes, professional shampoo, hair revitalizers, polishes, mousses, and keratin.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
REBECA es madre de dos hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad y cuentan con su familia propia, ella quedo viuda hace muchos años gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo saco a su familia adelante, actualmente se dedica al tejido de mantas de lana  de alpaca, animal cuya lana es muy apreciada por su calidad  que vive en el altiplano, el trabajo que realiza es por encargo es decir que le dan toda la materia prima y ella se encarga de tejer manualmente con palillos en su domicilio, vive en  la población de Achacachi, a dos horas de distancia de la ciudad de La Paz considerada ya una ciudad intermedia.
.
.
El crédito  requiere para comprar lana  y asi poder confeccionar las mantas por cuenta propia  mejorando sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rebeca is the mother of two grown children, who have families of their own. She has been widowed for many years, and thanks to her hard work, she was able to provide for her family. Now she weaves alpaca wool blankets, which are prized for their quality. Alpacas live in the highlands. 

Rebeca makes her merchandise to order, that is, customers give her the materials, which she weaves with sticks in her home. She lives in the town of Achacachi, two hours from La Paz, a medium-size city. She will use the loan to buy wool to make blankets to sell, thereby increasing her earnings and raising her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy wool to make clothing.

loans.name: Etta

texts.en: Etta is 40 years old and lives in Buchanan along with her husband and three children, ages 4 months to 19 years old.  She has been selling oil for the past 18 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil for her business. She hopes to build a house and to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more oil for her business.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip lives in Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay county. Homa Bay county is located in southwestern Kenya and borders Lake Victoria, the second largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing. A few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay county is Ruma National Park. This is a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Philip is married and has sixteen children. Both Philip and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for thirty five years and they are currently growing maize, cassava, millet, sorghum, sunflower, and watermelon. Philip is excited about keeping bees, as beekeeping does not entail a lot of work.

This is Philip’s first loan with Honey Care. He is interested in working with Honey Care because it offers them an opportunity to acquire beehives on a loan basis and because they will provide a market for his honey. He intends to use the income generated from beekeeping to pay for his children’s fees and to provide for their basic needs. Philip’s hope for the future is to increase his number of hives for more honey production.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Benta

texts.en:
Benta lives in Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay county. Homa Bay county is located in south-western Kenya, close to both the Tanzanian border and Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake. Despite the proximity to the lake, water infrastructure in Homa Bay remains quite undeveloped, and inconsistent rains and occasional droughts make life difficult for farmers in the area. Nonetheless, farmers have adapted to these challenges, particularly by diversifying their crops to include cassava, sunflower, sorghum, bananas, groundnuts and millet, as well as drought-resistant varieties of papaya and mangoes. Although beekeeping has not traditionally been practiced in the region, many individuals have expressed interest in keeping bees and are knowledgeable about their pollination benefits. 

Benta is a widow with five children. She is a farmer. She has been farming for ten years and she is currently raising maize, sunflower, beans, millet, and sweet potatoes. She is looking forward to beekeeping because it is a good opportunity for her to generate income.

This is Benta’s first loan with Honey Care. She intends to use the income generated from beekeeping to pay school fees for her children and to provide for their basic needs. Benta’s hope for the future is to increase the number of her beehives and expand her beehive project.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique es un hombre de 26 años de edad, el está casado y viven en el Departamento de Sololá.
El es un hombre trabajador que desea sacar adelante a su familia. Actualmente se dedica a la compraventa de productos de consumo diario, el tomo la iniciativa de tener su propio negocio, porque cuando él era pequeño se iba a trabajar junto a sus hermanos a tiendas de consumo diario a  la ciudad capital, con el propósito de aportar a la economía de sus padres. Por lo que ahora cuenta con una fuente de ingresos y ganancias que le ayudan a contribuir a la economía de su familia gracias a su esfuerzo.
Ahora que lleva varios años de experiencia ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo de Q 8,000.00 para la compra de materiales de construcción ya que desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda porque se encuentra deteriorado. El préstamo lo pagara con el trabajo que actualmente tiene.
Su sueño es terminar la remodelación de su vivienda para que cuando tengan a sus  hijos puedan tener una vivienda en buen estado.
texts.en:
Enrique, who is 26 years old, is married and lives in the Sololá department. He is a hard-working man who wants to help his family to get on in life. He currently makes a living buying and selling everyday groceries. He decided to set up his own business, because when he was little he and his siblings used to go to work in shops selling basic groceries in the capital city, with the aim of contributing to his parents' finances. So now he has a source of income and profits which help him to contribute to the family finances, thanks to his hard work. 

Now he has several years' experience he has decided to ask for a loan of 8,000 GTQ to buy construction materials as he wants to replace the roof on his hose since it is in a poor condition. He will pay off the loan from the work he already has. His dream is to finish making improvements to his home so that when they have children they will be able to have a home which is in a good condition.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for carrying out home improvements.

loans.name: Eladio

texts.es:
Eladio en un joven hijo mayor de la familia él es soltero, tuvo que dejar los estudios y dedicarse a la producción de leche junto a su familia viven en la comunidad de Tipampa de la población de Achacachi ubicada a dos horas y media de distancia de la ciudad de La Paz considerada ya una ciudad intermedia.
 El posee unas cuantas vacas que son de su propiedad y que se encuentran actualmente dos en producción de leche,

Con el crédito Eladio  adquirirá una vaca más y así incrementar poco a poco su producción y a futuro su sueño es tener su propio hato de ganado  con mayor producción y así poder ser independiente económicamente
texts.en: Eladio is the oldest child in his family and is single. He had to quit school and join his family in producing milk. They live in the Tipampa section of Achacachi, located two and a half hours from the medium-size city of La Paz. Eladio owns a few cows, two of which are producing milk. Eladio  will use this loan to buy another cow so that he can slowly increase his output. He hopes to one day have a herd of milk cows and greater output so that he can be financially independent.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio agradece a los inversionistas por el apoyo brindado y por el préstamo porque el ayudo a incrementar el capital del negocio, él continua dedicándose a la agricultura, a la ganadería y a la venta de madera, él requiere el préstamo para comprar más madera. (La comunidad de Pilco – Grande está ubicado en el distrito de Huayllabamba dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo en el  departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en: Julio thanks the lenders for their support and for this loan, which he needs to increase his working capital. He is still farming, raising livestock, and selling wood. He needs the loan to buy more wood. The town of Pilco Grande is in the Huayllabamba district of Paucartambo province in the Cusco department of Peru.

loans.use: To buy more wood.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Fatmata. She is married and has two children, aged 29 and 23 years. In 1992, Fatmata established her materials, cottons, lace, etc., business. She began her business to help her husband in the running of the home. Her business is located in the outskirts of town, and her main customers are women. 

Fatmata used proceeds from her business to provide livelihood for her family and also paid school fees for her children

Working seven days a week and eleven hours a day, she earns about 800,000 Le (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more materials for resale. She hopes that this loan will help her get profit for her to continue supporting her family.  
 
She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for more clothing materials for her business.

loans.name: Princess

texts.en:
Princess is running a shop in Buchanan, the capital city of Ground Bassa county, which is good at producing fish in the Liberian market. In the market, Princess sells lots of items like African suits, fashion clothes, artificial hair, etc. She started this business with help from her sister, and learned the trade from her mother. Presently, she is challenged by the size of her shop and low income. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more African suits, fashion clothes, artificial hair, etc. for her business. she enjoys her business because it has improved her life and her children's lives. Princess is an 8th grade dropout, 39 years old, and single with a child that is one and a half years old, is in school, and lives at home. Her dreams are to expand her business even more and send her child to college.

loans.use: to buy more African suits, fashion clothes, artificial hair, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice has been running a shop where she sells charcoal by bag, in the area of Buchanan where she lives with her two children and husband. Her husband is a local businessman. She said, she is very happy with her business for many reasons. For one, her business supports her and her family. 

Alice started this business 10 years ago. She is a high school graduate, and is 40 years old. Her dream is to become an international businesswoman and educate her children. She is requesting a loan to buy additional charcoal for her business.

loans.use: to buy additional charcoal for her business.

loans.name: José Vladimir

texts.es:
José de 27 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado de educación básica, abandono los estudios, cuando tuvo que mudarse de domicilio. Se trasladó con su madre, para donde vive actualmente después de esto le toco trabajar duro porque comenzaron de cero prácticamente.  Esta acompañado y su compañera de vida se dedica  a los quehaceres del hogar y a cuidar a su hijo de 2 años. 

Él trabaja de en una peluquería, en asocio con otro amigo pagando alquiler, por el uso de un local en el centro de la ciudad. Al llegar a este lugar pudo aprender el oficio de peluquero, tiene de experiencia de 13 años y en el negocio ya es reconocido por la clientela.
Un amigo le enseño este trabajo. El local está a  5 cuadras de donde vive y trabaja toda la semana, de 8:00 am a 6:00 pm. 

El préstamo lo utilizara en la compra de un sillón, comprar máquinas para corte de cabello y dos ventiladores, esto le ayudara a brindar mejor servicio. Sin el crédito no puede hacer estas mejoras, ya que no cuenta con el suficiente capital.
Quiere mejorar esto porque está bien fuerte la competencia y donde se le brinde un mejor servicio se irán los clientes, que le generan ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de su familia.

Sueña con tener un local propio y ampliarlo pudiendo generar las suficientes utilidades que garantice, la sostenibilidad del negocio, siendo una fuente de empleo para otras personas que se dedican a este oficio y que en este momento están desempleados.
texts.en:
José is 27 years old. He went to school till the fifth grade of primary school. He stopped going to school when he had to move. He moved with his mother to where he lives now and he had to work hard because they started practically from zero. He is in a common law marriage and his life's companion is a housewife and cares for their two children.   

He works in a barber shop. He partnered with a friend, renting to use the locale in the city center. When he arrived at this place he was able to learn the trade of barber. He has 13 years' experience and he is now recognized by customers in the business. A friend taught him this work. The locale is 5 blocks from where he lives and he works all week from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. 

He will use the loan to buy a chair, clippers and two fans. This will allow him to offer better service. Without the loan he can't make these improvements, since he doesn't have enough enough capital. He wants to improve because the competition is very strong and where a better service is offered is where the customers will go, and they generate income to cover his families needs. 

He dreams of having his own locale and expanding it to be able to generate enough profit to guarantee his business' sustainability and making it a source of income for other people who work in this trade and who are unemployed at this time.

loans.use: to buy a chair, clippers and two fans. This will allow him to offer better service.

loans.name: Lyra

texts.en:
Lyra is a married woman and a mother of five children.  She lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol.  Lyra operates a sari-sari or variety store selling various goods and items to the people in her place. She is also a farmer.

Lyra is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, snack foods, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries and to pay for the school fees for her children.  With this, she will be able to improve her store and continually send her children to school.

Lyra hopes of improving their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, snack foods, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 41-years-old and married with two children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines.  Roselyn is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Roselyn has been pig fattening for three years and also earns additional income from buying and selling frozen products and rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: El Roble Group

texts.en:
Irma is a 42-year-old woman who is a new member of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank group called “El Roble,” which means “The Oak Tree.” Irma watched the progress of the eleven women in the Trust Bank for a while and then decided to join the group. This is her first loan cycle. Irma sells used clothing six days each week from 10 a.m. to 7 p.m. in a nearby market. She plans to use this loan to purchase more clothing to resell and she will take advantage of the year-end holidays when there is increased business and therefore more income. The income generated by her business supports her two children so that they can stay in school. Her daughter is in college and studies law and her son is in high school. Irma fully understands that education is a vital key to a successful future, an understanding shared among the almost 19,000 women in Friendship Bridge.

The women in the Trust Bank “El Roble” group are engaged in commercial ventures and sell various items like clothing, perfumes and beauty items, cleaning products, and vegetables and fruit. They work hard each day to earn income in order to provide a better future for their families. Friendship Bridge not only provides loans to clients but also gives monthly training. Some of the topics covered during the training include business management, financial planning, and over-indebtedness. Other topics include health, nutrition, and self-esteem. As many of the ladies have had no education at all, this is a great opportunity for them to learn and improve their lives.

All of the ladies in the Trust Bank “El Roble” group welcome the opportunity to secure loans and education. They are most appreciative to Kiva investors and want to send greetings during this holiday time to all!

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: JAVIER se dedica junto a su esposa a la elaboración de quesos en la ciudad de El Alto ademas de hacer trabajos de albañileria y construccion de canales de riego El credito sera destinado para capital de inversion pues el sueño de Javier es incrementar su producción de leche mediante la compra de una vaca lechera de gran rendimiento
texts.en: Javier works with his wife making cheese in the city of El Alto. He also works in bricklaying and building irrigation canals. The loan will be used for investment capital because Javier's dream is to increase milk production by buying a high producing dairy high cow.

loans.use: to invest in his cheese business.

loans.name: Zenobia

texts.es:
Zenobia agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y por el apoyo brindado, ella continua dedicándose a la agricultura, a la venta de frutas y a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas, chanchos y otros, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. 
(La comunidad de Pilco – Grande está ubicado en el distrito de Huayllabamba dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo en el  departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Zenobia is grateful to the investors for the loan and for the support that has been given. She continues to work in agriculture, selling fruit and raising small animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, pigs and more. She requires the loan to buy small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens. 

The community of Pilco – Grande is located in the district of Huayllabamba in the province of Paucartambo in the department of Cuzco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Bebsy

texts.es: Bebsy de 40 años de edad es una mujer casada que tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 19 y 21 años. Desde hace 5 años su esposo aportó el capital semilla, para que ella mediante la actividad comercial generara ingresos vendiendo mercancía a crédito entre sus amistades y su idea resultó muy exitosa, porque muy pronto logró ganar una clientela doméstica entre amigos y familiares que hoy se ha extendido a referidos por estos.  Jeans, camisas, pantalones y suéteres además de perfumes y accesorios femeninos son los productos que comercializa directamente a su clientela  mediante crédito y contado, trabajando desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche diariamente comprando a grandes proveedores. Su metra mas adelante es tener un local abierto al público y fidelizar sus clientes con el propósito de aumentar las ventas y las utilidades, porque sueña con poder financiar la educación de sus hijos para potencializar su éxito futuro. En la actualidad, Bebsy requiere atender la demanda de final de año, para despedir el 2013 con el incremento de sus utilidades, vendiendo mas, pero su capital de trabajo no es suficiente, para responder a la demanda del mercado y para ello ha reccurrido a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará jeans, camisas, blusas, calzados, colonias, perfumes etc. Con ello logrará atender su clientela y   sentirse muy satisfecha por el deber cumplido.
texts.en:
Bebsy, 40, is married and has two children, ages 19 and 21. Five years ago, her husband gave her seed money to start a money-making business selling merchandise on credit to friends. The idea turned out to be successful because she shortly gained customers among her friends and relatives. Today her clientele has grown through referrals.  She sells jeans, shirts, pants, sweaters, perfumes, and women's accessories directly to customers on credit and for cash. She works from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m. daily and buys from wholesalers. Her goal is to have a shop open to the public and win the loyalty of her customers so that she can increase sales and profit. She dreams of paying for her children's education so that they can have a bright future.

Bebsy needs to meet year-end demand so that she can sell more and increase her profit, but she doesn't have enough working capital to meet market demand. So she has applied to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for her first Kiva loan, which she will use to buy jeans, shirts, blouses, shoes, colognes, perfumes, and more. She will be able to service her customers and to feel satisfaction in accomplishing her goal.

loans.use: to buy jeans, shirts, blouses, shoes, colognes, perfumes, etc.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 28 years old and has one children in school.

She is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. Geraldine requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Geraldine has been pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Asbubu

texts.ru: Асбубу 64 года, вдова, одна воспитала 3 детей. Асбубу имеет среднее образование, дети помогают по хозяйству. Семья очень дружная, отношения в семье очень хорошие. Асбубу в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 2002 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Асбубу в хозяйстве имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 теленок, 10 овец и 7 коз, а также имеет земельный надел размером 3,20 ГА, на которой выращивает ячмень, пшеницу, сено. Ее сельхоздеятельность приносит около 3,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, от продажи молока, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Доходы от хозяйства позволили Асбубу вырастить и обустроить детей. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Асбубу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом -на покупку телят. Доходы от кредита Асбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем хочет сделать ремонт дома.
texts.en: Asbubu is a 64-year-old widow raising three children.  She has a high school education and her children help her around the farm.  Her family is very close and they have good relations.  As the main source of income for her family, she has been raising livestock and crops since 2002, a business she started with 5,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her hard work, Asbubu's farm now has two dairy cows, one calf, ten sheep, seven goats and she also has a 3.2 hectare plot of land on which she grows barley, wheat and hay.  Her farm bring in about 3,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of milk, which covers her family's basic needs.  The income from her farm has allowed her to raise and provide for her children.  With the goal of developing her business further, Asbubu has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan to buy calves.  She plans to use the income from this loan to develop her business further, and she also wants to make repairs to her home in the future.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush lives in Ranchpar village of the Ararat region. She is a farmer with five years of experience. Over these years of hard work, Anush was able to build a greenhouse where she cultivates greens and different types of vegetables. Anush also keeps a pig and ten chickens. Anush lives together with her husband and two children ages 17 and 25 years old, who help Anush with farming activities. 

Anush currently asks a loan of  $2,200 to be able to purchase supplies needed for her farm. Particularly she will use the loan in purchasing seeds and fertilizer for land cultivation and forage for feeding the livestock. Anush has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately was not able to repay it. However, thanks to hard work during recent times, she was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

So Anush has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. The loan will be a huge support for Anush and her family and they will be very grateful to lenders for their goodwill and support.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and fertilizer for land cultivation and also forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Elina

texts.en: Elina is an accountant by profession. To tackle financial hardships, she became involved in agriculture 5 years ago. In particular, the farm that Elina runs consists of 3 pigs and some arable land where she cultivates greens and different fruit trees. Elina's husband helps her with farming activities, and they work hard to manage it in a sustainable way and earn good income for their family. Elina is a mother of 2 little kids and perfectly manages to take care of the household and at the same time run a farm. Now this hardworking and enthusiastic woman asks for a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a pig, chickens, and also some forage for feeding the livestock. A few years ago, Elina has already taken a loan from a local financial institution but unfortunately wasn't able to return it back. However, thanks to her hard work during recent times, she was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, Elina has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. This loan will greatly help Elina and her husband to continue their farming business and make it profitable.

loans.use: to pay for pigs, chickens, and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Lwambi

texts.en: Lwambi lives in Changamwe in Mombasa, Kenya. He is 45 years old, and he is a married man with eight children under his care. He is a trained tailor, and he has been doing this as his business for more than ten years, and the business has been doing great. He has employed someone to help him run the business. He learned of Milango through friends who asked him to join so that they could save and have access to funding for their business. He now seeks a loan to buy material, thread, and buttons for his business. He hopes that in the next five years he will be running more than one shop. The challenge that he faces is the rental charges and bad debts that he incurs at times. The income that he will raise from the business will improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy material, thread, and buttons

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is a happy man that his motorcycle business has improved since the last loan. He was able to repay the loan without much challenge. He is planning to buy another motorbike so that he can employ someone to run it so that he can raise more income for his family. 

His ambition is that in the next five years he will buy more motorbikes and employ more youth in the area. The major challenge that he has to deal with is the high fuel costs . The income that he will raise will improve his standards of living and also pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Roza

texts.en: Roza lives in Tsav village with her husband. The couple are involved in cattle breeding. Specifically, they keep a livestock of cows, pigs, chickens and sheep. With the help of agriculture, the family manages to sustain their living and cover basic costs. As the income that comes from agriculture is vital for their living, Roza would like to enlarge their livestock. The requested loan of USD 3000 will be a huge support for Roza to purchase two cows and a calf. This loan will help her to increase her agricultural income and improve her family's living conditions. As this is Roza's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who have not had access to credit products previously because they have no credit history. Roza and her husband will be very grateful to lenders' for their goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for two cows and a calf

loans.name: Salihu

texts.en:
Salihu is a Ghanaian artisan who specializes in hand-carved masks and sculptures. He would like to expand his workshop by offering employment to additional carvers. Salihu has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story:

"Upon the death of my father, I was sent to live with one of my father's closest friends, a renowned traditional carver for the then Akwamu chief and the people of Akwamu. I worked with him for about 15 years, during which time I learned the styles and techniques of the Ashanti and Akwamu people. My work began to flourish and achieve recognition. Today, I have apprentice carvers working with me to learn the art of carving. I am always grateful to you for taking part in the funding of this microcredit. I will work hard to benefit from your assistance. May Allah bless you all."

Use the link below to view Salihu's hand-carved wood masks and sculptures on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/3753

loans.use: to expand his workshop by hiring additional carvers

loans.name: José Guadalupe

texts.es:
José Guadalupe es un microempresario cliente de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

José es casado y tiene una niña de 3 años. Vive en casa propia y desde hace 10 años tiene su negocio, una tienda de abarrotes.
 
En su tienda él vende abarrotes en general, frutas y verduras; así como carnes frías y lácteos. Este préstamo lo pide para invertirlo totalmente en su negocio, ya que en esta  temporada surte productos, vende más y esto se ve reflejado en sus ingresos.

Gracias al esfuerzo que pone en su negocio ha logrado hacerlo crecer y su reto es continuar así, agrandando el local para poder ofrecer más mercancía.
texts.en:
José Guadalupe is a micro business client of Kubo Financiero, and this is his story:

José is married and has a three-year-old daughter. He lives in his own house and has had a small grocery store for 10 years. He sells general merchandise, fruits, vegetables, cold cuts, and milk products. He has applied for a loan to invest in his business, as it is the season to stock merchandise and sell more to increase his income. Thanks to the effort he has put into his business, it has grown. His goal is to keep it growing and expand the space to be able to offer more merchandise.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise to increase his sales.

loans.name: Justo

texts.en:
Justo lives in Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay county. Homa Bay county is located in south-western Kenya, and borders Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing and a few work in the small, but slowly growing, tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay county is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Justo is married and has nine children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for thirty years and they are currently growing maize, cassava, and beans on their farm. Justo is excited about beekeeping as it is a good source of income and he loves honey.

This is Justo’s first loan with Honey Care. He is interested in working with Honey Care because it provides him with an opportunity to access modern beehives. He intends to use the proceeds from beekeeping to pay for his children’s school fees. His hope for the future is to invest in more beehives and expand his beekeeping project.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay county. Homa Bay county is located in south-western Kenya, close to both the Tanzanian border and Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake. Despite the proximity to the lake, water infrastructure in Homa Bay remains quite undeveloped, and inconsistent rains and occasional droughts make life difficult for farmers in the area. Nonetheless, farmers have adapted to these challenges, particularly by diversifying their crops to include cassava, sunflower, sorghum, bananas, groundnuts, and millet, as well as drought-resistant varieties of papaya and mangoes. Although beekeeping has not traditionally been practiced in the region, many individuals have expressed interest in keeping bees and are knowledgeable about their pollination benefits. 

Joyce is a widow with five children. She is a farmer. She has been farming for 15 years now and she is currently growing bananas, mangoes, kale, tomatoes, papaya, and butternut. She is looking forward to beekeeping because it is a good source of income and it does not involve much in terms of management.

This is Joyce’s first loan with Honey Care. She is interested in working with Honey Care because of the training services they offer and the loan offered to them is favorable. She intends to use the proceeds from beekeeping to pay school fees for her children and to invest more in her farming. Her hope for the future is to increase the number of her beehives she has to about 15 to enable her to produce a lot of honey.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Ninoska Teresa

texts.es:
Ninoska tiene 24 años de edad es soltera tiene un hijo de 4 años, vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
Es integrante de la VRC SAN FRANCISCO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Pantano, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

Ninoska se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar semilla, abono, urea, insecticidas, herbicidas.
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta para trabajar en el campo e invertir en los fertilizantes.

El sueño es tener su casa propia. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades y el mal clima. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Ninoska is 24 years old and single. She has a 4-year-old child and lives in the canton of Ventanas, in the province of Los Ríos. She is a member of the communal bank San Francisco, which is located in the area of Pantano in the canton of Ventanas. The members make a living through agricultural activities and raising livestock.

Ninoska works in agriculture, growing corn and rice. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase seeds, fertilizer, urea, insecticides, and herbicides. With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy what she needs for work in the fields and to invest in fertilizers.

Ninoska's dream is to have her own home. The challenges she faces are illnesses and bad weather. In her free time, she likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for growing corn.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
A personal chef by trade, Christopher prides himself on his creativity in the kitchen. With nearly 30 years of experience, he confidently states that he can create over 3,000 menu items. Recently, while trying his hand at cooking at a large restaurant, he only felt a further desire to continue working on his own. 

Christopher hopes to open his own commercial kitchen to cook his myriad of healthy dishes to sell at local farmers' markets and yoga centers. He feels that his expertise will be received well in such health-conscious communities.

“I try to offer my clients healthy alternatives that they can enjoy, but I don’t sacrifice on taste!” he said.

In addition to cooking for his customers, Christopher has also been offering cooking classes throughout the area. “Cooking is therapeutic for me, and I want to share this experience with everyone,” he explained. 

Christopher has also gained a degree of celebrity worldwide through making “chewing gum sculptures”. Using only his mouth, he can create miniature sculptures of all shapes on demand. Creations as intricate as a man riding on a horse are not a problem for him to make. Having appeared on shows such as David Letterman, Jay Leno and America’s Got Talent, Christopher’s unusual talent is a testament to his level of creativity.

Christopher plans to use his $5,000 Kiva loan to pay for the necessary permitting and licensing to open his own kitchen in San Diego.

If successful in his cooking venture, he hopes to someday start an above ground shrimp farm where he can provide customers locally grown shellfish.

loans.use: to pay for the necessary permitting and licensing to open his own kitchen in San Diego

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma, 43 years old, is married to a farmer and blessed with three children. She manages a hog raising business and earns a net income of 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) per hog. Her profits are usually spent on the school allowances of her three children. Due to insufficient funds, she would like to avail a loan from generous lenders amounting to 9,000 PHP to purchase hog feeds for her hogs. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase hog feeds for her hogs

loans.name: Kaja B Group

texts.en:
Amani is a single man in his early 20s with two years of experience in his current tailoring business. He also sells clothes from the same business. He works from 7:00 am to 6:00 pm and is able to make a fair business profit. 

This is Amani's 3rd loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he will use to buy tailoring materials to fill extra business orders. He used his previous loans to buy new and modern tailoring machines and more materials for his business. He payed back all his previous loans successfully. Amani used his business profit to cover household expenses and bought a cupboard and a radio. He dreams to be successful in his life. 

He will share this loan with his loan group "Kaja B," which has a total of 6 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials to be able to fill extra business orders.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more grocery items for her variety store. Her loan is also helpful in her pisonet business (a computer mounted and assembled in a wooden safe box where a timer is the one that determines how long a player sitting in the seat in front of the machine will be using it). Her income from business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for another PHP 49,000 loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Leticia dreams to have a bigger store and hopes to support her grandchildren. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Linda. She is married and has three children who are 13, 6, and 4 years old. In 2008, Linda established her grocery shop business. She started her business because she wanted to assist her husband in the running of the home. Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 SLL every month from this business. 

Linda used proceeds from her last loan to provide for her family and pay school fees for her children. She also built a temporary structure on her land to help secure it. Linda is now selling palm oil alongside her grocery business. Linda has successfully repaid her second loan and now requires a new loan of 3,000,000 SLL in order to buy more groceries and palm oil for her business. Linda is a very serious business-woman. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more groceries and palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Hiyasmin

texts.en:
Hiyasmin works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 15 years now.

Hiyasmin requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like spices, fish, meat, canned goods, etc. In the future, she would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like spices, fish, meat, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Jeany

texts.en:
Jeany is 42 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jeany has been raising pigs for four years and also earns additional income from a manicure service.
