Jeany is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 60 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Editha has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Joean

texts.en:
Joean works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell herbal medicine business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years now.

Joean requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of herbal medicine to sell. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of herbal medicine to sell

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is 27 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Hazel has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Josie works hard to support her family.

She has a pre-paid mobile load business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. She is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to purchase additional pre-paid mobile loads for her pre-paid mobile load business.

Josie has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional pre-paid mobile load

loans.name: La Nouvelle Alliance Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Chinama est une Commerçante depuis 7 ans, conseillère et membre d’un groupe d’Affaires « La nouvelle Alliance» âgée de 53 ans, mariée et mère de 10 enfants qui , 4 étudient et 6 autres sont déjà mariés. Elle est vendeuse de friperie. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de l’IMF Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir  pour acheter 6 ballons de friperies. Son conjoint, lui aussi, est commerçant. Elle avait reçu son premier fonds par le biais de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son chiffre d’affaires,  scolariser, nourrir ses enfants et préparer leur avenir. Au finish, Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs, en leur accordant de crédit sans garantie matérielle et qui sont exclues du système classique bancaire, surtout, dans la période des conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Chinama has been a merchant for seven years and is an advisor and a member of the business group "La Nouvelle Alliance." She is 53 years old, married, and a mother of ten children, of whom four go to school and the other six are already married. Chinama sells used clothing.

She is seeking a loan through the micro-finance institution Hekima in order to expand her business.

This new loan will be used to buy six bales of used clothing.

Chinama's husband is also a merchant. She had received her original funds through him.

In the future, she would like to increase her sales, educate and feed her children, and prepare for the future.

Finally, Chinama thanks Hekima for supporting female entrepreneurs, who are excluded from traditional banking services, without requiring collateral, especially in this period of conflict in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy six bales of used clothing

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en: Geofrey is happy that he was able to receive a Kiva loan, which he was able to repay without much challenge. His electronics business has improved since the last loan. He now seeks another loan to buy electronic gadgets to expand his business operations. He hopes that in the next five years he will be running a wholesale business. The challenges that he has been facing in the business include lack of capital and the competition from other traders. The income that he will raise from the business will improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy electronic gadgets to expand his shop

loans.name: Inocente

texts.es:
Don Inocente es un hombre de 65 años de edad, no pudo estudiar, ya que desde muy pequeño se tuvo que incorporar a las actividades agrícolas, apoyando a su padre a llevar el sustento para su familia.  Está casado, su señora se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas. De los ocho hijos que tiene, solamente dos aún viven con él, uno se dedica a la carpintería y la señorita realizo un curso de sastrería. Además, le ayuda a su madre en el negocio (tortillería).

 Inocente trabaja la agricultura desde hace 51 años, también ahorrando pudo comprar un camión de carga, con el cual su hijo realiza viajes a los vecinos cuando están recogiendo la cosecha agrícola, por tal servicio percibe ingresos. 
También hace varios años trabajo con los cultivos de hortalizas (cebolla, tomate, sandia, entre otros)
La milpa la tiene a 2 km. de distancia de su casa y trabaja de lunes a sábado, en la actividad agrícola le ayuda su hijo.

El crédito lo necesita para reparar el camión, este lo tiene que llevar al taller porque se le han dañado varias piezas,  sin este préstamo no podrá aprovechar esta época en que se está recogiendo la cosecha y le solicitan el servicio de transporte y poder ganar un dinerito extra para su familia.

En este momento el trabajo con granos básicos, no es  muy rentable, solo es de subsistencia y piensa que estableciendo un pequeño negocio le ayudaría a mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
Su sueño es establecer un negocio, por poner un comedor.
texts.en:
Inocente, 65, was not able to go to school because he had to start farming at an early age to help his father support the family. He is married, and his wife makes and sells tortillas. Of their eight children, only two still live with him; one is a carpenter, and his daughter studied dressmaking and helps her mother in the tortilla business.

Inocente has been farming for 51 years and saved to buy a truck, which he uses to pick up the neighbors' harvest. He earns money offering this service. He also grows fruits and vegetables like onions, tomatoes, and watermelons. His farmland is two kilometers from his house, and he farms Monday to Saturday with his son's help.

He needs the loan to repair his truck, which he has to take to the shop because some parts are damaged. Without the loan, he will not be able to take advantage of this harvest season to provide transportation service and earn a little extra money for his family. He now grows basic grains, which is not very profitable and barely pays the bills. He is thinking about opening a small business to raise his family's standard of living. He dreams of starting a business and opening a small restaurant.

loans.use: to repair his truck.

loans.name: Kobina

texts.en:
Kobina is a Ghanaian artisan who specializes in handcrafted African masks. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of wood, aluminum plates, and sandpaper for his crafts. Kobina has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story:

"My father painted, and I also have a flair for drawing and painting. This makes designing masks something that comes naturally to me. What I did to hone my skills was to visit art workshops where I could observe artisans. I was so eager to learn more that I got a raw mask and started to make designs and paint it with acrylics. The outcome was very good, and that is how I started in this art form. I value very much the support you've offered me through this microcredit. You enable me to reach the highest height I desire. Thank you so much."

Use the link below to view Kobina's African masks on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/8495

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of wood, aluminum plates, and sandpaper

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul is a carver from Ghana. He would like to stock up on raw materials for his masks and hand-carved decor items. Abdul has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story:

"While in junior high, I lived in a neighborhood where there are a lot of carvers, and I assisted them in sanding masks and other carvings. This got me interested in woodcarving, and I also did well in art classes at school. After graduation, I decided to go back and assist the carvers. Even though they couldn't pay me much, I felt happy and satisfied, and was glad to go to work with each new day. Now I work on my own. The most challenging part of this craft is when I am designing my work, and the nicest part is when I mix colors to paint. My hope is to become an excellent designer. I thank you all very much. This loan will help me to craft many designs that will eventually permit me to sell more."

Use the link below to view Abdul's African masks and carvings on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/8770

loans.use: to stock up on raw materials for his carvings

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela lives in Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay county. Homa Bay county is located at the south-western tip of Kenya, and its northern end is dominated by Lake Victoria, the largest lake in the Southern Hemisphere. Lake Victoria extends into three east African countries, allowing cross-border flows of goods and people, and a market day in a lakeside town in Homa Bay county often boasts traders from Uganda, Tanzania, and Kenya, all of whom arrive in boats to ply their wares. Although the semi-arid nature of much of Homa Bay county means that poverty rates are quite high, many people in the region hold a strong cultural emphasis on education, and as a result school attendance figures around Homa Bay are above the national average. 

Pamela is a widow with six children. She is a farmer and has been farming for 15 years now. She is currently growing maize, papaya, bananas, cassava, and beans on her farm. She is interested in beekeeping because it does not require extensive management, especially because bees look for their own food.

This is Pamela’s first loan with Honey Care. She likes working with Honey Care because of the management services they provide for the beehives. She intends to use the income generated from her beehives to pay her children’s school fees and invest more in her farming. Pamela’s hope for the future is to expand her beehive project and to help her friends to also take up the project.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Asunción

texts.en: Asunción, a Poblano dairy farmer, is viewed as a leader by his neighbors and fellow farmers due to his vision. He is open and readily-accepting of new technologies and always tries to benefit fully from his available resources. His dairy cows generate an abundant quantity of manure daily, which he plans on feeding to his newly-acquired 12 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester. The treatment process inside his digester will convert the "waste" into two potent resources -- renewable biogas and a potent biofertilizer. The biogas will displace the expensive, non-renewable propane his family currently uses to cook and heat bathwater. Asunción will apply the biofertilizer to his crops, including the forage crops he uses to feed his cows. He'll save money, reduce the environmental impact of his farm, and take advantage of a resource he hasn't adequately benefitted from. This loan represents 46% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove.

loans.use: to purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon lives in Changamwe in the suburbs of Mombasa, Kenya. He is 39 years old and is married with three children who attend school. He runs a small retail shop that deals in hydraulic items. He has been in the business for more than seven years, and the business has been doing great. He started the business with some money that he received from his friend. He later learned of Milango through friends who invited him to join so that he could save and be able to access funding for his business. He now seeks a loan to stock hydraulic items for the business. The major challenge in the business is customers not paying in time. He hopes that in the next five years his business will grow large. The income that he will raise from the business will improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to stock hydraulic items

loans.name: Musyoka

texts.en: Musyoka lives in the Changamwe area, which is a suburb in Mombasa, Kenya. He lives there together with his family. He is 40 years of age and is married with two children. He has been dealing in the scrap metal business for more than five years and with this business, has been feeding his family. He buys scrap metal and then sells the materials to recycling companies. In this way, he raises extra income for himself. He has ambitions that his business will continue to grow into other areas. He knew Milango through friends and now he is seeking a loan to buy more scrap metal to increase his capacity. The major challenge that he faces in his business is transportation. The income that he will raise from this business will improve his standards of living and will also help pay the school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more scrap metal

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
A $600 loan is offered to Juliana to improve her business. She opened her animal sales business in 2009, with her own working capital of $400. Juliana is generating a good income from selling. Juliana will use this loan to buy chickens. She has been thinking of selling the animals for nearly five years. 

Juliana is married and she has one child. She lives in a town with her family, and her husband is a farmer.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Luisa Inocencia

texts.es:
Luisa tiene 53 años de edad es soltera tiene dos hijos de 13 y 11 años de edad, vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC SAN FRANCISCO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Pantano, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

Luisa se dedica a la agricultura  a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, semillas, urea, herbicidas, mata plagas.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. El sueño es tener sus cosas propias. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades y el mal clima.
En el tiempo libre le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en:
Luisa is 53 years old and single. She has two children who are 13 and 11 years old, and she lives in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. She is a member of the communal bank San Francisco, which is located in the area of Pantano in the canton of Ventanas. The members make a living through agriculture and raising livestock.

Luisa works in agriculture, growing corn and rice. She is requesting this loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, urea, herbicides and insecticides.

With the help of this loan, Luisa will be able to buy what she needs for agriculture. She dream is to have her own things. The challenges that she faces are illnesses and bad weather. In her free time, she likes to listen to music.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for planting corn.

loans.name: Apolonia Rocio

texts.es:
Apolonia tiene 41 años de edad estado civil unión libre, vive con sus hijos de 18, 14, 13 y 3 años en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC SAN FRANCISCO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Pantano, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

Apolonia se dedica a la agricultura  a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, semillas, urea, herbicidas.
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá adquirir los productos sin problemas por falta de dinero. Las compras las realizará en Mocahe.

El sueño es comprar una moto para trasladarse al lugar de las siembras. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia. En el tiempo libre le gusta pasear con su familia.
texts.en:
Apolonia is 41 years old and in a common-law marriage. She lives with her children who are 18, 14, 13 and 3 years old in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. 

She is a member of the communal bank San Francisco, which is located in the area of Pantano in the canton of Ventanas. The members make a living through agriculture and raising livestock. 

Apolonia works in agriculture, growing corn and rice. She is requesting this loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, urea, and herbicides. With the help of this loan, she will be able to acquire these products without any problems due to lack of money. She will make her purchases in Mocahe.

Apolonia's dream is to buy a motorcycle to help her get to the fields. The challenge she faces is competition. She likes to spend her free time with her family.

loans.use: to invest in growing corn.

loans.name: Sonia Rubidia

texts.es:
Sonia de 31 años de edad,  los estudios que realizo fueron hasta noveno grado, ella está acompañada, su esposo tiene 32 años de edad, él se encuentra fuera del país y el trabajo que desempeña es en la construcción. La señora tiene 2 niñas, una de 9 años que está cursando tercer grado en la escuela de la comunidad y la otra niña tiene 2 años a la cual se la cuidada un familiar mientras ella sale a trabajar.
Sonia trabaja en una librería y cuando no hay clases en las instituciones escolares que están cerca, ella trabaja siempre con su jefe como asistente en el despacho contable que él posee.
Tiene 1 año de trabajar desempeñando estas funciones, su horario de trabajo es de 7:00 am a 5: pm de lunes a viernes. El préstamo lo necesita para mejorar su vivienda en la parte de la cocina, la cual está deteriorada, esto le permitirá tener la vivienda más seguras y darle una mejor protección a sus 2 hijas, sus sueños es seguir estudiando ha tomado la decisión de terminar el bachillerato y esta año ingresara a estudiar los fines de semana, pero su principal sueño y de su compañero de vida, es lograr el sueño de su hija que es realizar los estudios en profesorado que es lo que desea.
texts.en:
Sonia is 31 years old. She studied up to the ninth grade. She is married; her husband is 32 years old and lives abroad, where he works in the construction sector. Sonia has two daughters. One is nine years old and is in third grade in the local school and the other one is two years old and stays with a relative when she goes to work.

Sonia works in a book shop. When the local schools are closed, she works as an assistant for her boss, who has an accounting firm. She has been doing this for a year, Monday to Friday, 7 am to 5 pm.

She is requesting a loan to make some improvements to her kitchen, which is in bad shape. With these improvements, her house will be a safer place for her daughters. One of her dreams is to finish her studies, so she has decided to take the courses she needs to receive her high school degree. She will start studying during the weekends this year. However, their biggest dream is to be able to pay for their daughter’s studies: she wants to become a teacher.

loans.use: to make some improvements to her kitchen, which is in bad shape.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is married and manages his own general store to make a living. He has been selling different kinds of groceries for three years, and he earns well for the family’s needs. 

He joined GDMPC and had borrowed a loan recently to buy additional grocery goods to sell. He wants to sustain his business and wants to improve it to have a better source of income in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Carlo

texts.en:
Carlo is studying for a BS in Marine Technology at Misamis Institute of Technology in Ozamiz City. His parents are simple residents in their village who earn good enough for their needs. 

He joined GDMPC recently and had borrowed a new loan to pay the school tuition fee for the second semester. He is thankful to GDMPC that it helps deserving individuals to follow their dreams of success.

loans.use: to pay his school tuition fee.

loans.name: Basharat Ali

texts.en:
Basharat Ali is the age of 39; he is an honest person living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He has been conducting this business for many years and getting income for his family. 

He is milkman by profession. He sells milk in his community and sells bull calves to the butchers. He has a few cows; he produces a little milk two times a day from them. He provides door-to-door milk to his customers using his bicycle and takes money on a monthly basis. 

He found that he can get more milk from buffaloes instead of cows, so he made a plan to buy a buffalo. But the buffalo price is more than a cow, and he does not have enough cash in hand to buy a buffalo.

Therefore, Basharat Ali requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so he would be able to buy one buffalo for getting more milk to sell.

Basharat Ali wants to keep buffaloes instead of cows to grow his herd and wants to maintain his cowshed because he does not have a proper cowshed for his cattle as well. He hopes that he would be able to buy a buffalo and would be able to get maximum income.

Basharat Ali thanks Kiva and its partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for getting more milk to sell.

loans.name: Altanzagas

texts.en:
Altanzagas lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her step-daughter currently lives with them. Using her previous loan, Altanzagas finished her house renovation completely. 

Now Altanzagas is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy an electric car for transportation purposes. The advantage of an electric car is that it contributes to cleaner air in cities because it emits harmless pollutants into the air and wastes less fuel. This borrower will be using the car for small furniture transportation purposes.

loans.use: to buy an electric car

loans.name: Munkhragchaa

texts.en: Mr. Munkhragchaa is the only one who is generating income for his family as his wife has taken her maternity leave. So he decided to sell Christmas holiday items such as gifts, Christmas trees, and decorations. For this cause, he is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT. He will render taxi service during the day and sell Christmas goods in the evening.

loans.use: to sell Christmas items

loans.name: Urozgul

texts.ru: Урозгул 57 лет. Она живет в районе Джиликуль с мужем, двумя сыновьями, двумя невестками и внуками. Урозгул занимается земледелием вот уже 41 год. У нее очень большой опыт в выращивании сельскохозяйственной культуры. Она никогда не боялась трудной работы и всегда трудилась во благо семьи. Муж все эти годы работает с ней совместно. Также им помогают сыновья и невестки. Урозгул с помощью семьи собрала урожай хлопка и теперь готовится к посеву пшеницы. Она запрашивает кредит для приобретения семян пшеницы и минеральных удобрений. Урозгул за счет прибыли с продажи урожая хочет закупить для своего хозяйства мелкий и крупный рогатый скота.
texts.en: Urozgul is 57 years old.  She lives in the Jilikul region with her husband, two sons and their wives and children.  Urozgul has been involved in agriculture for 41 years.  She has a tremendous amount of experience in raising crops.  She has never been afraid of hard work and she always strives to do better for her family.  Her husband has worked by her side all these years, and her sons and their wives also lend a hand.  With the help of her family. Urozgul has gathered the cotton harvest and how she is preparing to sow wheat.  She is asking for a loan to buy wheat seeds and mineral fertilizer.  With the income from the sale of this wheat, Urozgul wants to save up money to buy small and large livestock for her farm.

loans.use: to buy wheat seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Duo Inspiracion Group

texts.es: Duo Inspiracion Doña Ana de 43 años de edad,  es una mujer muy trabajadora y madre de 1 niño de 6 años de edad, doña Ana quien todos los días se dedica al comercio ofreciendo a su clientela , huevos de diversos, tamaños, queso crema, y como actividad secundaria se dedica al destace y venta de carne de pollo y tambien vende gallina en pie vende los fines de semana, a Dios gracias es  una señora bien conocida en el sector por donde ella vive,en esta oportunidad esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia para la venta (queso crema,huevos, y pollos para deztase, esperando que ustedes le ayuden con el credito, ella ya ha trabajado 3 creditos en kiva y no a caido en mora es muy responsable en sus pagos.
texts.en: Duo Inspiracion communal bank member Ana is 43 and the hardworking mother of a six-year-old son. Ana works every day, offering her customers different types and sizes of eggs, cheeses, and creams. She also slaughters and sells chickens and sells laying hens on the weekends. She is thankfully well known in the neighborhood. She has applied for a loan to buy merchandise to sell (cheese, cream, eggs, and slaughter chickens). She hopes that the lenders will help her with funding. She is in her third loan cycle with Kiva and has been responsible and never late with the payments.

loans.use: to buy cheese, cream, eggs, and slaughter chickens.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
This is Edna, 55, a resident of Tondo, Manila, Philippines. She is a mother of five children and she is married to Johnny, a welder. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, Edna works hard to provide income for the family's everyday expenses and her children’s studies. 

Edna operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy accessories and toy products from wholesalers and then she repacks them and sells them for a little profit. Her products are assorted candies, toys, and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to her low prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Edna is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy different toys and accessories needed in her business.

Edna dreams that her business will be successful and hopes to make a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy different toys and accessories needed in her business.

loans.name: Burulsun

texts.ru: Бурулсун 53 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. Четверо детей женаты, проживают отдельно и самостоятельно. Самая младшая дочь живет с родителями и помогает по хозяйству. У Бурулсун - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Бурулсун занимается животноводством, стартовав 36 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бурулсун, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 15 овец, 15 коз, 1 лошадь. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бурулсун обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом -на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Бурулсун планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение младшей дочери.
texts.en: Burulsun is 53 years old and is married with five children.  Four of her children are married and living independently.  Her youngest daughter lives at home with her parents and helps around the farm.  Burulsun has a high school education, and she is engaged in raising livestock as the main source of income for her family.  She started this business 36 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 5,000 som KGS.  Thanks to her hard work, Burulson now has three cows, 15 sheep, 15 goats and one horse on her farm.  Her monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS).  With the goal of developing her business further, Burulsun has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan to buy sheep so she can increase her head of livestock.  She plans to use the income from this loan to further increase her head of livestock on her farm and to save money for her youngest daughter's education.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is happy that she has finished repaying her previous loan. The loan ended and she never faced any challenges in repaying the loan. She raised extra income from the previous loan and she now has an employee in her business. She also owns a retail shop that she runs, and this has been giving her extra income. She now seeks another loan to open up a new water point, so that she can reach more people in the area that she operates.The challenges that she faces is bad debts. She will use the income that she raises to pay school fees for her children and also improve her living standards.

loans.use: to open up a new water point

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Josephine works hard to support her family. She has a vulcanizing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Josephine is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment for her vulcanizing business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment.

loans.name: Laina

texts.en: Laina is 44 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family. Laina runs a recycled materials retail business in the Philippines and requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional recycled materials to sell. Laina has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional recycled materials to sell

loans.name: Jemabel

texts.en: Jemabel is 23 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Jemabel has a food stall business in the Philippines. She requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business. Jemabel has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food stall business.

loans.name: Joena

texts.en:
Joena is 33 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy groceries to sell.

Joena has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending. Joena aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Fidèle Bourgeoise

texts.fr: Fidèle est une dame âgée de 31 ans commerçante. elle dispose d'une vente à emporter dans un quartier de la ville de 02 ans environ. Elle bénéficie d'une bonne expérience dans le domaine. Elle voudrait avec ce crédit pour augmenter les casiers de boisson . Cela va également augmenter son chiffre d'affaire ainsi que son bénéfice et lui permettra aussi d'être en règle dans son commerce. Les revenus générés lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Elle a comme ambitions pour son activité de faire dans la vente en gros des boissons.
texts.en:
Fidèle is a 31-year-old shopkeeper who has owned a take-away shop in a part of the town for about two years. She benefits from a good experience in this area.

Fidèle would like a credit in order to increase her stock of beverages. This will in turn increase her sales, from which the earnings will allow her to maintain her good business standing.

Earnings will allow her to [also] better support the needs of her family.

Fidèle aims to become a beverage wholesaler [one day].

loans.use: to increase her stock of beverages

loans.name: Emma Cedric

texts.fr: Cédric est un jeune homme de 25 ans célibataire sans enfant. Il est commerçant dans un marché de la place depuis quelques années. son activité fonctionne bien il a juste un problème lié à la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à chaque fois à faire écouler tout son pour pouvoir se réapprovisionner. C'est pour cela qu'il sollicite de crédit qui lui permettra non seulement de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle mais aussi d'augmenter ses ventes ainsi que son bénéfice. Bénéfice qui sera réinvesti dans son activité pour l'agrandir.
texts.en:
Cédric is a young 25-year-old single man, without any children. He has been a merchant in a local market for several years. 

His business is going well, but he has a problem in that he must sell all his stock before he can acquire more. For this reason, he is seeking a loan, which will not only allow him to better satisfy the needs of his customers but also increase his sales and thus his earnings.

Earnings will be reinvested so that he can expand his business.

loans.use: to increase his stock of telephones and accessories

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 49 years old and married. Together with his spouse they have been blessed with two children. He has a motorcycle transport business and has been running this business for the last two years now and it has been profitable.

Peter plans to use this loan to service his motorcycle so that it can be in good condition. He also plans to buy masonry equipment. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children by paying for their school fees.

This is Peter's first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and his future hopes are to own more than one motorcycle for his transport business as well as educate his children and give them a good life.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Ellen Faith

texts.en:
Ellen Faith dreams of becoming a teacher. She is currently attending Stella Maris College for her BS degree in education. Her determination and passion for teaching makes her eager to pursue her ambition.

Ellen used her previous loan from GDMPC in purchasing textbooks and uniforms. Recently, she took a new loan to finance the miscellaneous school fees. 

She wants to finish her studies and have a better job in the future.

loans.use: to finance miscellaneous school fees.

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
Jesús es hombre de 39 años de edad, el está casado y vive junto a sus nueve hijos de los cuales son, 3 hombres y 6 mujeres en el Departamento de Sololá.
Comenta que se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 20 años, cultivando repollo, papa y zanahoria a unos kilómetros de su vivienda. Como también lo comercializa en el mercado local de su comunidad, con el propósito de incrementar sus  ingresos  y  ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su familia.
En la actividad que realiza puede disponer de su tiempo para realizar otras actividades para el beneficio de su familia. Por lo que ahora está solicitando un préstamo de Q 4,000.00 para la compra de pilones (semillas) de repollo y semillas de papa que servirán para su cultivo.
Su mayor sueño es comprar un terreno para poder incrementar sus ingresos con la finalidad de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Jesús is a 39-year-old man.  He is married and lives with his nine children, three of whom are sons and six of whom are daughters, in the Sololá region.

He says that he has worked in agriculture for 20 years, growing cabbage, potatoes, and carrots a few kilometers from his home.  He also sells it in the local market of his community, with the goal of increasing his income and earnings to be able to cover his family’s expenses.

With this job, he can use his time to do other things to help his family as well.  So he is asking for a loan of 4,000 quetzales to buy cabbage seedlings (seeds) and potato seeds that will work for his planting.

His biggest dream is to buy a plot of land to be able to increase his income, with the goal of improving his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cabbage seeds and potato seeds to plant.

loans.name: Gloria Stephannie

texts.es: Gloría de 20 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeño hijo de 7 meses de edad. Gloria se dedica a la venta de variedad de prendas de vestir como ropa para caballero, damas y niños así como variedad de sandalias. Gloria solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción del baño sanitario ya que en la actualidad lo tiene al aire libre y desea terminarlo lo antes posible. Con el crédito comprará: ladrillo, lámina galvanizada, madera, cemento y arena.
texts.en:
Gloria is 20 years old and lives in her own home with her life companion and their seven-month-old son. She sells a variety of clothes for men, women, and children, as well as different types of sandals.

Gloría is requesting a loan from FUSAI so that she can build a sanitary bathroom. The current bathroom is out in the open, so she wants to finish this project as soon as possible. She will use the loan to buy galvanized sheets, wood, cement, and sand.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets, wood, cement, and sand for building a bathroom.

loans.name: Elmurod

texts.ru:
Элмурод живет на районе Гиссар. Он является отцом двоих детей. Элмурод с женой воспитывают двоих сыновей. Старшему сыну 7 лет, младшему 5 лет. У Элмурода нет высшего образования, но есть права на вождение машины. Он занимается предоставлением услуги такси. 
  Сейчас он запрашивает кредит, чтобы купить собственную машину и заниматься услугой такси. Для приобретения машины ему не хватает денег, поэтому он обратился за помощью. На сегодняшний день у него нет машины, и он не работает. Элмурод остро нуждается в кредите. Помогите Элмуроду!
texts.en: Elmurod lives in the Gissar region.  He and his wife have two sons together; the elder son is seven years old and the younger son is five.  Elmurod does not have a higher education, but he does have a driver's license and he works as a taxi driver.  He is now asking for a loan so he can buy his own car with which to offer his taxi services.  He doesn't have enough money to buy a car, which is why he is asking for help.  Since he does not have a car at this time, he doesn't currently work.  Elmurod badly needs this loan.  Please help him!

loans.use: to buy a car

loans.name: Jeanette Del Rosario

texts.es: Jeanette es una humilde joven de 33 años de edad con aspiraciones en la vida, es madre soltera de cinco hijos, tres de ellos están en edad escolar, para los gastos del hogar y estudios, ella se apoya con la mensualidad que le pasa el padre de sus hijos y su trabajo como secretaria en una oficina de leyes, Jeanette estudia la carrera de Lic. en Derecho con un postgrado en Aduana, desea tener su titulo para brindarle a sus hijos una mejor estabilidad económica por medio de un trabajo mejor remunerado. Solicita el crédito porque se acerca la etapa final de su carrera y necesita ingresar al curso de titulación, el cual tiene un costo alto comparado a sus ingresos mensuales, lo que solamente en cuotas y a largo plazo lo podrá pagar, gracias a la oportunidad de financiamiento que brinda Kiva y Afodenic.
texts.en:
Jeanette is a humble young woman, 33 years old, with aspirations in life. She is a single mother of 5 children and 3 of them are school age. She is helped with the household expenses and school expenses through the support of monthly payments from the father of her children and from her work as a secretary in a law office. Jeanette is studying for a BA degree in law with a postgraduate in customs. She wants to have her degree in order to provide her children financial stability through higher paying work.

She is asking for a loan, only for fees which she will pay back over time, because she is in the final stage of her degree and she needs to enroll in her class which has a high cost compared to her monthly income. She is grateful for the funding opportunity offered by Kiva and Afodenic.

loans.use: to pay for final degree expenses and postgraduate studies

loans.name: El Madroño Group

texts.es: El grupo lo forman cinco socias comerciantes trabajadoras una de ellas es María del Socorro tiene la edad de 61 años, casada, con un hijo que dependen de ella, su negocio es la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 30 años. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de naranja dulces, y naranja agria al por mayor. María Emelanea mujer de 47 años su negocio es la venta de frutas y verduras, María Neli tiene 50 años se dedica a la venta de perecederos, Teodora tiene la edad de 60 años vende  verduras, Aura de 47 años  vende pinol, pinolillo, tiste, semilla de jícaro, cerial.
texts.en:
This group consists of five members who are hardworking merchants. One of them is María del Socorro. She is 61 years old, married, and has a child who is dependent on her. Her business involves selling fruits and vegetables, which she has done for 30 years. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy sweet oranges and sour oranges in bulk.

María Emelanea is a 47-year-old woman who sells fruits and vegetables. María Neli is 50 years old and sells perishable goods. Teodora is 60 years old and sells vegetables. Aura is 47 years old and sells traditional beverages such as "pinol", "pinolillo", and "tiste", as well as calabash seeds and candlesticks.

loans.use: to buy sweet oranges and sour oranges in bulk.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Desde el año 1980, hace justamente 33 años, Miriam aprendió de su madre el oficio de confecciones; primero elaborando ropa a sus familiares y cuando estuvo lista, se proyectó a ofrecer el servicio de confecciones a la medida a particulares. Hoy Miriam tiene en su domicilio su propio taller, donde confecciona ropa para damas, caballeros e infantil, tiene  muchos clientes que ha fidelizado a lo largo de su trayectoria en el oficio, que solicitan el servicio sobre medidas y tambien ofrece el servicio completo que  incluye materias primas e insumos y que elabora mediante tallas. Sus compras las realiza de contado en almacenes especializados y vende de contado y a crédito, trabajando insistentemente, desde las 8 dela mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, con una frecuencia diaria. Su meta es  remodelar su vivienda y lograr dia a dia consolidar a su clientela, para poder ahorrar, que es uno de sus mayores desafios. En la actualidad Miriam está aplicando a un credikiva, primer finaciamietno que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará telas, hilos y accesorios, que adornarán los vestidos que  producirá en la temporada de final de año, para que su clientela y las familias, disfruten las navaidades y despidan el 2013 elegantes, y bailando las 4 fiestas y preparandose desde ya para los carnavales de Barranquilla, que es la fiesta mas esperada de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Beginning in 1980, 33 years ago, Miriam began learning dressmaking from her mother. At first she made clothes for relatives, and when she was ready, she offered dressmaking to order. Today Miriam has her own workshop in her house, where she makes women's, men's, and infant's clothes. She has gained many loyal clients, who ask for tailoring service as well as complete service that includes the materials to make made-to-measure garments. She buys from specialty stores on credit and sells for cash or credit. She works hard each day from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m. Her goal is to remodel her house and daily build her customer base so that she can save, which is one of her main challenges.

Miriam has applied for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy fabric, thread, and accessories for the garments she will make for the year-end season so that her customers and their families can enjoy Christmas, say good-by to 2013 in style, dance at the four festivals, and get ready for the Barranquilla carnival, the city's most anticipated festival.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and accessories.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Mary Grace has been in this business for 2 years. Mary Grace earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Mary Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Lucilla

texts.en:
Lucilla is 56 years old and widowed with three children.

Lucilla works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like canned goods, soft-drinks and other groceries.

Lucilla has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from a cafeteria she operates.

Lucilla aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, soft-drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Mwendwa

texts.en: Mwendwa lives in Changamwe area. He is a husband and a father of two. Both his two children attend school at the nearby primary school. He has been in the scrap metal business for the last seven years. His business has really grown ever since he started and he has been able to employ three people to help him run his business. He heard of Milango through friends who invited him to join, so that he would be able to access funding for the business that he runs. He has ambitions that his business will grow bigger with many employees in the future. He is seeking a loan to buy more scrap metal. The challenges that he faces in the business is fluctuating market prices and theft.The income that he will raise will improve his standards of living and also enable him to take his children to school.

loans.use: to buy more scrap metal.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es:
Narcisa es una mujer trabajadora de 50 años de edad, que junto a su esposo se esfuerzan cada día por un futuro mejor para su familia. 
Ella solo pudo estudiar hasta segundo año de educación básica, por motivos económicos queriendo ayudar a sus padres, para que no les faltara nada a sus hermanos, tuvo que abandonar los estudios. Ademas, en sus tiempos era muy limitado el acceso a la educación. Esta casada y su esposo se dedica a la elaboración de queso, en un pequeño negocio familiar. Sus hijos ya formaron su propio hogar, así que solo viven ellos dos.
Ella se dedica al comercio de granos básicos, entre estos comercializa maíz, frijol maicillo, entre otros productos. Tiene 7 años de experiencia en el negocio y este oficio lo aprendió gracias a su esposo, también realiza los quehaceres del hogar y le ayuda a su marido en la elaboración de quesos. El negocio lo tiene en su propia casa y lo atiende todos los días, pero cuando mas actividad hay es en los días de plaza del municipio.
El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar el grano en esta época de cosecha que hay abundancia en el mercado, así adquirirlo a un bajo costo, mantenerlo almacenado y cuando hayan mejores precios venderlo y obtener un margen de ganancia. En este momento no cuenta con capital para invertir, por eso necesita el financiamiento para aprovechar la oportunidad de negocio.
Su sueño, es poder arreglar su vivienda, ya que esta en malas condiciones, espera que con los ingresos que obtenga, ir ahorrando una parte y cuando tenga lo suficiente, realizar las mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
Narcisa is a hardworking, 50-year-old woman.  Together with her husband, she fights every day for a better future for her family.  She was only able to study through her second year of primary school because she wanted to help her parents so that her siblings were never in need of anything; to do this, she had to abandon her studies.  When she was a young girl, there was also limited access to education.  

Narcisa is married, and her husband earns a living making cheese in a small family business.  Her children have built her and her husband a home, and the two of them live there together.  

She makes a living selling basic grain crops, including corn, gama grass, beans, and other items.  She has been doing this for seven years, and she learned this trade from her husband.  She also takes care of the home chores and helps her husband to make cheese.  Narcisa runs her business out of her house, and she works every day.  When there is a lot of buying activity, she also sells in the town square.  

The loan that she is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy the recently-harvested grains that are currently most plentiful in the market; this will allow her to buy the grains at a very low cost, to store them, and to then sell them when the price rises, thereby increasing her net profit.  She currently does not have her own capital to invest.  She needs financing in order to take advantage of this business opportunity.

Her dream is to fix up her house, since it is in poor condition right now.  She hopes to save some of the income she makes over time so that, once she has saved up enough, she can improve her home.

loans.use: to buy the recently-harvested grain crops that are currently in abundance at the local market.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 31 years old from Gilgil town and is married. She has two children aged 10 years and 7 years old who are in school.

Elizabeth has a retail shop that she has been running for the past two years. She has applied for her second loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable her to buy cooking fat, oil, eggs, milk, etc. to add to her stock. 

Elizabeth hopes to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, eggs, milk, etc.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 32 years old from Nyahururu. She is divorced and takes care of her two children aged 10 and 7 years old. They are both studying at school.

Anne has been running her business of selling secondhand clothes for the last one year. To enable her to buy more stocks of clothes to sell to her customers, she has applied for her first loan of KES 50,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

Anne's monthly income right now is KES 10,000 and her intention is to use profits anticipated from her expanded business to educate her children, pay back her loan to VisionFund Kenya and add more stocks to her business for more profits. In the future, Anne hopes to have a successful business and for her children to have good education.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mira  (Gualaceo) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Mira está formado por 7 mujeres quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia de Zhidama que pertenece al cantón de Gualaceo, este cantón tiene un clima templado propicio para el cultivo de una gran variedad de frutos, cuenta con varios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza. Su gente es muy hábil y es un lugar en donde se elaboran el mejor calzado del país, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, su mayor fuente de ingreso es el comercio, crianza de animales y la agricultura.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Rosa, esta hace 2 años en el grupo de crédito Mira, le gusta este tipo de créditos porque comparte buenos momentos con sus compañeras, se ayudan en momentos difíciles y en los momentos buenos  comparten sus alegrías.
La Señora Rosa tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 21, 16, 14 y 10 años de edad, su primer hijo está trabajando y le ayuda económicamente, dos de sus hijos están estudiando en el colegio y su ultimo hijo está en una escuela del sector, su esposo se dedica a laborar como jornalero, la casa en la que viven es propia.
Doña. Rosa se dedica a las tareas del campo, cría pollos, cuyes, cerdos y ganado  del cual vende la leche, cultiva  y la cosecha es para la venta y consumo de su hogar. También se dedica a la elaboración de guaipe (trapos para limpieza). 
El dinero de su crédito es para comprar ganado y alimento para sus animales. Su meta es aumentar la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
The Mira credit group is made up of seven women who live in the outskirts of the Zhidama parish in the Gualaceo region.  This region has a moderate climate well-suited to cultivating various types of fruit trees.  It also has a number of places where you can enjoy nature.  Its people are very capable and it is where they make the best footwear in the entire country.  The main source of income in the area is trade, animal husbandry, and agriculture.

One of the group members is Rosa.  She joined the group two years ago.  She likes this type of credit group because she can share good times with her group mates.  They help each other in times of difficulty and share their joys in the good times.

Rosa is 37 years old.  She is married and from her marriage has four children, ages 10, 14, 16, and 21.  Her oldest child is working and helps her out financially.  Two of her children are studying in secondary school, while the youngest is in the local elementary school.  Her husband works as a day laborer.  The house that they live in is their own.

Doña Rosa works in the fields.  She raises chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, and cattle, from which she sells the milk.  She also gardens, and her harvest is both to sell and to eat in their home.  She also works making guaipe (cleaning rags).  

The money from this loan is to buy cattle and feed for her animals.  Her goal is to increase her animal-raising business.

loans.use: to buy cattle and animal feed

loans.name: Rosángela

texts.es:
Rosángela es una joven emprendedora que, a sus 20 años de edad, ya es propietaria de una pequeño salón de belleza y spa. El negocio lo inició hace 4 meses motivada por la necesidad de generar ingresos para aportar a la economía familiar, desde que estaba realizando sus estudios secundarios, comenzó a desarrollar la actividad, por lo que ya tiene experiencia y mucha práctica en la labor. Actualmente genera un empleo directo y trabaja todos los días.
Con el ánimo de fortalecer su negocio para seguir posicionándolo en el sector, desea comprar insumos y herramientas de trabajo que le hacen falta como pinzas para el cabello, tratamientos capilares y una máquina patillera, esto le permitirá ofrecer un mejor y más completo servicio a sus clientes, dando como resultado un mejor nivel de ventas e ingresos.
Rosángela, con su proyección hacia el cumplimiento de sus objetivos y con su espíritu de superación, quiere seguir laborando fuertemente para acreditar y fortalecer su negocio, darle permanencia en el tiempo y en un futuro cercano desea generar más oportunidades de empleo; esto le permitirá disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida y podrá seguir aportando a la economía familiar.
texts.en:
Rosángela is an enterprising young woman who, at the age of just 20, is already the owner of a small beauty salon and spa. She started the business 4 months ago, driven by the need to generate an income so she could contribute to the family finances. She began working in this area during her time in secondary education, so she has a lot of experience and practice in this kind of work. Now she has someone working for her and she works every day. 

In order to strengthen her business so she can position herself in the sector, she wants to buy supplies and work tools which she needs such as hair clips, capillary treatments and a trimmer. This will enable her to offer her clients a better and more complete service and result in a better level of sales and income.

With her strategy for achieving her goals and her desire for self-improvement, Rosángela wants to continue working hard in order to prove and strengthen her business. She wants to give it a long term future and in the short term wants to generate more employment opportunities. This will allow her to enjoy a better quality of life and continue to contribute to the family finances.

loans.use: to buy supplies and work tools which she needs such as hair clips, capillary treatments and a trimmer.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 36 years old from Nakuru. She is married to Micheal and they are blessed with three children aged 16, 10 and 7 years old.

Victoria has been operating as a farmer for 10 years. She earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. She has applied for her third loan of KES 80,000 from VisionFund Kenya. She plans to use her loan to start another business.

She anticipates using the gains from her farming activity to pay back her loan, educate her children and boost her new business. In the future, she hopes to buy a plot to build houses for rent to boost her income.

loans.use: to start up a clothing selling business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 66 years old and from Nakuru. She is married, though widowed, and blessed with one child aged 18 years.

Josephine sells second hand clothes and she has been in the business for two years. She earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. She has applied for her third loan of KES 45,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

Josephine anticipates using the gains from her business to pay her loan, educate her child and boost her business. In the future, she hopes to own a wholesale second hand shop.

loans.use: to boost her clothing selling business.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is 51 years old and from Nyahururu. He is married to Peris and they are blessed with three children aged 20, 17 and 14 years old.

Titus has been operating as a farmer for 20 years. He earns a monthly income of KES 18,000. He has applied for his third loan of KES 60,000 from VisionFund Kenya. He plans to use his loan to buy farm input for his farming activity.

Titus anticipates using the gains to pay for his loan, educate his children and boost his farming activity. He hopes to own a cereal shop in the future in order to earn more income and have a better living standard.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs for his farming activity.

loans.name: Ariunzul

texts.en: Mrs. Ariunzul lives with her family in a Mongolian traditional ger (a portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her husband run a tire repair shop. Her daughter is married and now lives in a separate house. She is requesting a loan of 3,200,000 MNT to buy home appliances for her daughter such as a television, vacuum cleaner and wardrobe. As a result, her daughter's family will live in a comfortable place. As a mother, she is happy to see her daughter getting married and living happily.

loans.use: to buy a television, wardrobe and vacuum cleaner

loans.name: Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
Niño Jesus es de Ciudad del este, esta en su primer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder salir adelante. También forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde quieren poder trabajar para mejorar sus ingresos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Estela, quien se dedica a la venta de comidas, que ella misma hace, y que sale a vender de forma ambulante. Es una persona muy trabajadora que son gran esfuerzo está saliendo adelante y creciendo lentamente.
Su sueño es poder seguir creciendo y es por eso que se está esforzando. Pide de este préstamo para la compra de insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus alimentos. Agradecen todas por la oportunidad que están recibiendo de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
“Niño Jesus es de Ciudad del este” is in its first cycle in the committee for women program, where all the members are putting forth a major effort to get ahead.  They are also part of the elimination of poverty program, where they work to improve their incomes.

Estela is one of the members and she sells food that she cooks herself, and sells it on foot.  She is a very hardworking person who is getting ahead and growing slowly.

Her dream is to be able to continue growing, so she is working hard.  She is asking for this loan to buy supplies so she can continue cooking.  [The members] are all grateful for the opportunity they are getting to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Bernardina Basilia

texts.es: La señora Bernardina tiene 34 años y dos hijos de las edades de 13 y 3 años, ella se dedica  a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad y huevo al por mayor en su  tienda de barrio que se encuentran ubicado en su mismo domicilio que es en la zona de Villa Adela de la ciudad de El Alto,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la señora Bernardina va a usar este préstamo para a la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es necesidad de surtir su tienda ya que se acerca la época de Navidad y desea comprar variedad de mercadería, la señora Bernardina enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que en la zona hay muchas tiendas de barrio, ella va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando mercadería y así incrementar su capital y poder tener un almacén ya que este es uno de sus deseos.
texts.en: Bernardina is 34 years old, has two children, ages 13 and 3, and sells primary needs products and eggs in quantity from her neighborhood store.  The store is in her home in Villa Adela in the city of El Alto.  This will be her first loan within the institution.  Bernardina will use the money from this loan to buy merchandise to stock her store because the Christmas season is approaching and she wants to buy a variety of merchandise.  Bernardina faces challenges with the competition because there are many neighborhood stores she wants to use the benefits to buy merchandise so she can increase her capital and be able to have a larger store, as this is one of her desires.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor, es viudo y tiene un hijo que ya es independiente, vive en casa propia ocupando dos habitaciones, la casa se encuentra en la zona tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como chófer por mas de ocho horas al día ya que con los ingresos que tiene debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo invertirá en el mantenimiento de su minibus ya que es su única fuente de ingresos  a pesar de ser de la tercera edad no percibe ninguna ayuda de parte de su hijo. 
El sueño de Victor es comprar otro minibus para percibir otra renta ya que conduciendo durante todo el día le resulta demasiado agotador,desea trabajar solo medio tiempo de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Victor is a widower and has an adult son.  He lives in a home of his own, located in the Tembladerani area of La Paz.

He works as a driver for more than eight hours a day because he needs to cover his expenses and pay for basic services.

He will use the money from this loan to maintain his minibus because it’s his only source of income.  Despite him being elderly, he doesn’t get any help from his son.

Victor’s dream is to buy another minibus so he can rent it out because he finds the daily conditions very exhausting.  He wants to work part time and improve his income and quality of life.

loans.use: to maintain his minibus.

loans.name: Dúo Elohim Group

texts.es: Dúo Elohim, está conformado por las señora Sabina de 61 años de edad, dedicándose por   más de 19 años a la venta de  blusas, mantas para camas, también elabora cortinas , faldas que sus clientes solicitan, doña Sabina viaja dos veces al mes al mercado de  Escuintla donde ya es muy conocida y solo llega a hacer entrega de las prendas que le solicitan sus clientes, en esta época aprovecha que sus clientes le piden colchas, suéteres por la época, por lo que solicita su crédito para comprar mercadería y lograr cubrir la demanda de sus clientes,ella ya a trabajado tres creditos en kiva y ha sido muy responsable en sus pagos espera que nuevamente le puedan ayudar en su negocio.
texts.en: The Dúo Elohim group was formed by Sabina who is 61 years old. She has been working for more than 19 years selling blouses and blankets, and she also makes curtains, and skirts that her customers ask for. Sabina travels two times a month to the Escuintla market where she is very well known and only has to take the orders her customers have requested. She wants to take advantage of the season while customers are asking for quilts and seasonal sweaters which is why she is asking for a loan in order to buy merchandise and meet the demand of her customers. She has had three Kiva loans and has been responsible in her payments and is hoping to be helped again in her business.

loans.use: to buy new clothing to sell

loans.name: Jose Gilberto

texts.es:
José, es el encargado de generar los ingresos familiares, cuenta con una familia compuesta por su compañera de vida y sus hijos, vive en casa propia, se dedica a vender a vender minutas y cultivar maíz, lo hace desde las 6:00 a.m. hasta las 4:00 p.m., tiene una experiencia de 10 años lo que le evita alguna dificultad para ejercerlo.
Invertirá en el pago de mano de obra y una desgranadora, con lo que podrá procesar la cosecha y tenerla listan menor tiempo, espera mejorar sus ingresos con los cales cancelara sus deudas y podrá ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida.
José sueña con ampliar cada una de sus actividades económicas, para ofrecer a su familia una mejor alimentación, vestuario, salud y educación.
texts.en:
Jose is in charge of the family income and his family includes his wife and children.  He owns his home and raises and sells corn from 6:00 am to 4:00 pm.  He has been doing this for ten years and this has kept him from having trouble doing it.

He will use the money from this loan to pay for labor and a thresher so he can process his harvest and have it ready in less time.  He expects to increase his income, pay his debt with the profit, and have a better quality of life.

Jose dreams of expanding one of his financial activities so he can offer better food, clothing, health, and education to his family.

loans.use: to buy a thrasher and pay for labor.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa, es acompañada, tiene dos hijos de 18 y 24 años de edad, debido a la necesidad de tener más ingresos para solventar los gastos familiares, hace tres años por iniciativa propia fundo una tienda en su casa de habitación, en la que ofrece variedad de productos de primera necesidad, su horario es de 5:00 a.m. has las 7:00 p.m., hasta la fecha no ha tenido ningún problema que le evite seguir con su negocio.
Comprará queso, aceite, crema, pan, golosinas, bebidas, sal, etc., con lo fortalecerá su negocio, espera atender mucho mejor a sus clientes, aumentar sus ventas, atraer a nuevos clientes y mejorar sus ingresos para cumplir debidamente con sus compromisos económicos.
Aspira tener un negocio más grande para tener los recursos para mejorar su vivienda y cambiar el estilo de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is married and has two children, ages 18 and 24.  She opened a store in her home three years ago because of a need to pay the family expenses.  There she offers a variety of primary needs products and works from 5:00 am to 7:00 pm.  To date she has not had any problems that would prevent her from continuing in her business.

She will use the money to buy cheese, cooking oil, cream, bread, snacks, salt, etc. to strengthen her business.  She expects to be able to provide better service to her customers, increase her sales, attract new customers, and improve her income so she can meet her financial obligations.

She wants to have a larger business so she can have the resources she needs to make improvements to her life and change her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José, es un joven que vive junto a su familia, es soltero, no posee ayuda del extranjero, se dedica a animar eventos sociales con su grupo de batucada, además  posee una pequeña venta de ropa, su mayor ventaja es que no tiene competencia en la zona.
Con el capital comprara equipo de sonido, con lo que dará un mejor servicio a sus clientes y podrá hacerse más popular, espera aumentar la clientela y mejorar su economía para apoyar en los gastos familiares.
Sueña con tener su propia casa e independizarse completamente.
texts.en:
Jose is a young man who lives with his family.  He is single and doesn’t receive any foreign assistance.  He organizes social events with his batucada dance group and also has a small clothing sales business; his main advantage is that he doesn’t have any competition in the area.

He will use the money to buy sound equipment so he can provide better customer service and become more popular.  He expects to increase his number of customers and improve his financial situation to support his family expenses.

He dreams of having a home of his own becoming completely independent.

loans.use: to buy sound equipment.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel, es soltero, no tiene hijos, para cubrir sus gastos personales se dedica a dar el servicio de tapizaría, en la zona no tiene competencia y hasta la fecha no ha tenido ningún problema en atender el negoció. Trabaja todos los días.
Comprará telas para tapiz, lo que tendrá el material para trabajar, espera dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, aumentar sus ganancias, atraer más clientes y cumplir con las cuotas del crédito.
Anhela con poder comprar su propia casa.
texts.en:
Manuel is single and has no children.  He does reupholstering to cover his personal expenses.  He doesn’t have any competition in the area and to date has not had any problems running his business.  He works every day. 

He will buy fabric so that he will have the necessary materials to work.  He expects to improve his customer service, increase his earnings, attract more customers and make his loan payments.

He wants to buy his own home.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Alba Janeth

texts.es:
Alba, solicita otro crédito para invertir en la compra de lociones, cremas corporales, labiales, polvos, etc., con lo que su inventario esta fortalecido para las épocas de fin de año.
Con el préstamo anterior logro surtir su inventario y aumentar sus ventas. Le genero ganancias superiores las que ha necesitado para cubrir las cuotas  y sus gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Alba is asking for another loan to buy lotions, body creams, lip sticks, powders, etc., so she can increase her inventory for the end of year season.

She used the money from the previous loan to increase her sales.  It generated increased income that she needed to cover her debts and family expenses.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 54 years old and married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lucia has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Lucia has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Lucia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Nancy works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing. Nancy is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Nancy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 59 years old and married with seven children.

Luisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Luisa has borrowed and repaid twenty loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Luisa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Monalin

texts.en:
Monalin is 30 years old and married with one child in school. Monalin works very hard to provide for them.

Monalin runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has requested a loan of 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell such as noodles, canned goods, biscuits, etc. Monalin has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Monalin would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell such as noodles, can goods, biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Yamileth

texts.es: Yamileth, tiene 36 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes.  Ella tiene 5 años de dedicarse a la elaboración y venta de lociones. Compra los insumos y prepara las lociones  para vender. Las vende envasadas  por encargo. El préstamo que solicita es el tercer ciclo y es por 21,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar materia prima como alcohol, esencias de perfumes,envases etc.para  la elaboración y venta de lociones. con el préstamo va poder mantener inventario de materiales y poder tener siempre el producto para vender. Su plan es crecer en clientes y que su negocio sea mas fuerte.
texts.en: Yamileth is 36 years old, married, has two children, and lives in Choloma, Cortes.  She has been making and selling perfumes for five years.  She buys her supplies to make her perfume and sells them to order.  She is asking for a loan in the amount of 21,000 Lempiras which she will use to buy supplies such as alcohol essences, bottles, etc. to make and sell perfumes.  She will be able to maintain her inventory of supplies and be able to have product to sell on hand at all times.  Her plan is to increase her number of customers so that she can strengthen her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es: María, tiene 59 años de edad, es soltera por viudez, vive en una aldea del municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa junto a sus 5 nietos. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura cultivando café, banano y maíz. Este cultivo lo tiene en un terreno cerca a su casa. La producción es vendida en el mercado local. Doña Santos ha obtenido varios prestamos para su negocio. Actualmente solicita el noveno ciclo y es por 17,000 lempiras y lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes  y abonos para la finca de café y compra de viveros para siembra.  Tiene como meta seguir ampliando los cultivos para poder obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria is 59 years old, a widow, and lives in a suburb of Santa Cruz de Yojoa with her five children.

She has been a farmer all her life, raising coffee, bananas, and corn.  These crops are on land near her home and she makes her sales at the local market.  Ms. Santos has had several loans for her business and she is asking for her ninth loan in the amount of 17,000 Lempiras to buy fertilizer and compost for her coffee farm.  She will also buy seedling.  Her goal is to continue expanding her crops so she can obtain better income.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Jaki

texts.en:
Jaki works for The Kenya Tea Development Authority (KTDA) Foundation. KTDA aims to bring a range of high-quality and affordable Barefoot Power solar lighting products to address a critical need for lighting and other basic energy uses among small-holder tea farmers in Kenya.

KTDA Foundation will accomplish this by leveraging the existing KTDA infrastructure to ensure that the solar lamps reach the farmers and that periodic payments are collected and accumulated for repayment of the loan.

Company Background

Kenya Tea development Authority Foundation is a non- profit charity of the Kenya Tea Development Agency (Holdings) Limited. Its key objective is to raise funds to initiate and support programs that improve the welfare of 560,000 small-holder tea farmers in Kenya. KTDA Foundation is the vehicle through which KTDA, its subsidiary companies and factory companies carry out corporate social responsibility activities.

There are eleven (11) counties that dominate in tea growing in Kenya and where KTDA operates most of its tea factories. These are Murang’a, Meru, Kisii, Nyeri, Kiambu, Kirinyaga, Kericho, Bomet,
Nandi, Nyamira and Embu. The common denominator in all the counties is low penetration of electricity. While the national penetration is estimated at 23%, these 11 counties have an average electricity penetration of only 16%. Kerosene is used by 80% of the households in these counties as the only source of lighting. 

Kerosene is expensive in use: a typical off-grid household spends over Ksh.18,000 (USD 200) per year on kerosene for lighting and mobile phone charging. Kerosene also has numerous adverse health effects on lungs and eyes, as well as fire related burns.


A Kiva loan will enable us reach over 1500 farmers with solar lighting and facilitate scale up of the program to other counties. The farmers will be able to get the solar lamps and repay the loan in installments after selling their tea to KTDA.

Partnering with Barefoot Power (www.barefootpower.com), a Kiva field Partner in Africa, will enable us access quality solar lamps and allow us to utilize the expertise that Barefoot Power has gained since its inception and put those learnings into practice.

loans.use: To buy and sell Barefoot Power's solar lighting products.

loans.name: Agadhu

texts.en:
Agadhu is a differently able man living with his parents, wife, and two young children in a small village in the state of Odisha in Eastern India. They all live in a thatched house surrounded by a small vegetable garden. In his youth, Agadhu was affected by a disease that resulted in completely losing the use of his left leg. He now moves around with crutches and supports his family by running a small vegetable stall near his house. He also sells wholesale to the weekly market in the larger village nearby and helped his mother purchased goats that they are raising at home for milk and will eventually sell for profit.
