Still, they are only earning 6,000 INR a month, which is hardly enough to support his parents and family. So Agadhu wants to expand the shop that he has run for four years and is seeking a loan to buy packaged foods, cosmetic items, and more vegetables that he will be able to sell at the weekly market in the nearby village. His vision is to build up to a large variety shop so that he will be able to build a more stable house and support his family members in living a good life.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing of packaged foods, cosmetic items, and more vegetables for his general store.

loans.name: Minette Liliane

texts.fr: Minette est une femme de 27 ans, célibataire et mère d'un enfant. elle possède et gère une boutique de vente des mèches et produits cosmétiques dans un quartier de la ville depuis 1 an. elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises en achetant des mèches, greffes et produits cosmétiques afin d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire et satisfaire sa clientèle. les bénéfices générés vont être réinvestis dans son capital d'un part et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille d'autre part.
texts.en:
Minette is a 27-year-old single woman, who is a mother of one child. She owns and has been running a shop, where she sells hair extensions and cosmetics in the area for one year.

She is seeking a loan to increase her stock and buy hair extensions, hair weaves, and cosmetics in order to increase sales and satisfy her customers.

Earnings will be reinvested in her business and to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, hair weaves, and cosmetics

loans.name: Biranchi

texts.en:
Biranchi is a 39-year-old differently able man who lives with his wife and daughter in Odisha, a state in Eastern India. To support his family, he runs a small street-side restaurant, or as the locals say “hotel.” Although he has some difficulty getting around because he does not have use of his left leg, he still has big dreams for growing his business. With 15 years of experience behind him, he now wants to expand the “hotel” to be a full service restaurant. This will require buying more food items and making a restaurant showcase and counter area.

To achieve this dream he has saved almost 25,000 INR. He is now asking for a matched loan of 20,000 INR to cover the remaining project cost. Biranchi hopes by growing his business he will improve his family’s standard of living and provide a quality education for his daughter.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing of more food items and making a restaurant showcase and counter area for his small hotel.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is applying for a loan of $600 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is single and 25 years old. She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stock to sell in her store. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. 
Elsa is living in a town near by the school; her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy her wares, including students.

loans.use: To buy cigarettes, sugar, coffee, sugar,  salt, milks, eggs, noodles and bread

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 70 years old and married. She lives at Lagag, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. In order to earn a living she takes in and raises pigs owned by her neighbors. With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs on her own as well.
 
Through Paglaum MPC she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed. Now, she requests a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy feeds for hog raising. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy feeds for hog raising.

location.town: SINDANGAN - LAGAG, SINDANGAN, ZAMBOANGA DEL NORTE

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is happy tending her little store. She is married with one child. The store is her means of earning a living in support of her family. Teresita keeps on running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores. Teresita believes that with PMPC's support as one family they will sustain and beat the competition.  

Teresita has reached her first year being a member of PMPC.  She has applied for a loan of PHP 14,900 for the store. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the label of member in good standing. She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store and from there provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase stocks for her sari-sari store.

location.town: SINDANGAN - LAGAG, SINDANGAN, ZAMBOANGA DEL NORTE

loans.name: Lynne

texts.en:
Lynne is married. She is earning a living with her buy and sell business selling clothing, curtains and pillowcases in her community. She earns well for her family. 

Lynne joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to buy additional clothing, curtains and pillowcases to sell. In the future, she wants to build a store where she can sell her products. She wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy additional clothing, curtains and pillowcases to sell.

loans.name: Najminiso

texts.en:
Najminiso was born in 1955 and is a widow. Her husband died some years ago. Najminiso has three adult children, two daughters and a son.

She sells women and men's clothing. Najminiso’s son studies and works in Turkey. He sends clothes from Turkey to his mother to sell in her shop. She has regular customers and wants to develop her business and maximize profit. 

She asks for a loan of 3,000 USD to buy clothes to increase her working capital. 

She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy clothes to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Jaylyn

texts.en:
Jaylyn studies business administration at Stella Maris College. Her greatest ambition is to finish her studies and get a job in the future. After joining GDMPC, her financial needs were lightened. She used her previous loan to buy school supplies like books, uniforms, etc. She asks for a new loan to cover the costs of her school allowances for the second semester.  

Jaylyn hopes to improve the general living condition of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to cover the costs of her school allowances for the second semester.

loans.name: Siempre Amigas  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Siempre Amigas está formado por 12 mujeres quienes se caracterizan por ser luchadoras y muy emprendedoras que buscan un mejor porvenir para sus hijos, su mayor fuente de ingresos son la crianza de animales, la agricultura y el comercio, son personas amables que aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Viven por la parroquia del Valle, este lugar goza de una belleza natural gracias a su geografía accidentada, cuenta con verdes campos, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo antiguo y lo moderno, El Valle poco a poco ha ido creciendo y por ello es una parroquia importante de la ciudad de Cuenca.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María, está realizando su cuarto crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito Siempre Amigas, en este tiempo ha mejorado sus lasos de amistad con todas sus compañeras, comparten un poco de su tiempo platicando de temas de su interés.
La Señora María tiene 63 años de edad, está separada pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 8 hijos de los que 5 ya son casados y viven  independientes, sus dos hijos solteros trabajan y se dedican al negocio de la familia el cual es la sastrería, la casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña María desde hace 20 años se dedica a la crianza de animales actividad que le permitido pagar el estudio a sus hijos y sacarles adelante, también desde hace 10 años aproximadamente aprendió la sastrería y ahora es un negocio familiar ya que trabaja con algunos de sus hijos, le va bien en esta actividad y espera seguir creciendo. 
El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de pollos y telas para así implementar estas dos fuentes de ingresos. Su meta es crecer en su negocio hasta llegar a tener un taller más grande.
texts.en:
The Siempre Amigas (Friends Forever) credit group is made up of 12 women who are known for being enterprising and tenacious.  They are searching for a better future for their children.  Their main sources of income are agriculture, trade, and raising animals.  They are very kind people who still keep up their culture and the traditions of their people.  They live in the El Valle parish, an area that enjoys a natural beauty thanks to its uneven terrain.  It is full of green fields; its architecture is a blend of ancient and modern.  Little by little, El Valle has been growing and therefore is an important parish in the city of Cuenca.

One of the group members is María.  She is taking out her fourth loan along with her friends and fellow members of the Siempre Amigas credit group.  In that time, she has strengthened the bonds of friendship with all of her group mates.  They spend a portion of their time sharing and chatting about things that interest them.

María is 63 years old.  She is separated, but she has eight children from her marriage.  Five of them are married and live independently.  Her two single children work in the family tailoring business. The house that she lives in is her own.

For twenty years, Doña María has raised animals.  This job has let her pay for her children’s schooling and get them ahead.  About ten years ago she also learned tailoring, and now this is a family business because she works with some of her children.  This is going well for her, and she hopes to keep growing.  

She is going to invest the money from this loan in the purchase of chickens and fabric to put to work in her two sources of income.  Her goal is to grow her business until she can have a bigger shop.

loans.use: to buy chickens and fabric.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 43 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Gina has been raising pigs for 19 years and also earns additional income from general store.

Gina is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 22 years old and married, with one child.

She earns a living by pig-fattening in the Philippines. Jovelyn is borrowing PHP 11,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional feed and vitamins.

Jovelyn has been pig-fattening for four years and she earns additional income from operating a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more fish to offer for sale.

Jessica successfully paid back her previous loan and she is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Jessica's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to offer for sale.

loans.name: Rodrigo De Jesús

texts.es:
Rodrigo, a sus 55 años de edad, se dedica a fabricar y comercializar estopa, lleva 12 años realizando esta labor y aprendió del oficio mientras trabajaba como vendedor de un almacén, cuenta con el apoyo de un empleado, trabaja todos los días tanto desde una bodega arrendada, como desde su casa, pues alterna su oficio con el cuidado de su madre con quien vive. Su mayor desafío es poder equilibrar el tiempo de trabajo y de cuidado a su madre, pues ya es una señora de avanzada edad y depende totalmente de él. 
El crédito que solicita es para comprar materia prima al por mayor (lino y cáñamo), así tendrá disponibilidad suficiente para aumentar su producción y mejorar las ventas e ingresos, con los que solventa los gastos económicos de su hogar, suple los gastos médicos de su madre y brindar alimento diario.
Rodrigo manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder tener un punto de venta que sea cercano a su casa para facilitar las condiciones de trabajo y al mismo tiempo seguir velando por el bienestar de su madre.
texts.en:
Rodrigo, 55 years old, makes his living producing and selling burlap. He has been doing this work for 12 years, and he learned this trade while working as a salesperson at a warehouse. He has the support of one employee. He works every day both from a rented warehouse and from his house, since he balances his work with the care of his mother, with whom he lives. His biggest challenge is balancing his time between work and caring for his mother, since she is advanced in age and depends on him completely.
The loan that he is requesting is to buy raw materials at wholesale (flax and hemp). This way he will have enough available to increase his production and improve his income, which he uses to cover household expenses and his mother’s medical expenses, and to buy daily food. 
Rodrigo states that his biggest wish is to have a point of sale that is close to his house to ease his work conditions and at the same time continue looking after the welfare of his mother.

loans.use: to buy raw materials at wholesale (flax and hemp).

loans.name: Natalia Andrea

texts.es:
Natalia es una joven de 24 años de edad, activa y emprendedora. Luego de buscar empleo por varios meses y no encontrar oportunidades laborales, decidió iniciar su propio negocio, una venta de alimentos fritos como empanadas, pasteles, panzerottis y otros productos, el oficio lo aprendió de su suegra y desde que inició su negocio ha tenido muy buenos resultados pues aprovecha la ventaja de estar ubicada cerca de una institución educativa del sector, sin embargo, hace algunos días se tuvo que enfrentar con la difícil situación de perder a su padre, quien falleció y, lo que ocasionó que descuidara un poco el negocio y por lo tanto las ventas decayeron.
Pero hoy en día, motivada por la necesidad de seguir aportando a la economía de su familia, retomó la labor y quiere fortalecer su negocio, para ello solicita el crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos al por mayor (verduras, harina de maíz, pollo, gaseosas) y una sombrilla grande, esto le permitirá mejorar la imagen del negocio y además podrá aumentar la producción para ofrecer a sus clientes, satisfaciendo sus gustos, así podrá mejorar la entrada de recursos para seguir velando por el bienestar familiar.
Natalia, siguiendo el ejemplo de su padre, sólo desea seguir llevando el sustento a su familia, por eso trabaja arduamente para lograrlo y, en un futuro cercano desea ampliar su negocio para generar mayor rentabilidad y así mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Natalia, who is 24 years old, is a lively and entrepreneurial young woman. After looking for employment for several months and not finding any work opportunities, she decided to start up her own business, selling fried food such as empanadas, pastries, panzerottis [deep fried savoury tarts] and other products. She learnt the trade from her mother-in-law and since she started her business she has had very good results, as she has the advantage of being located near to a local educational establishment. 

However, a while ago she had to face the difficult situation of losing her father, who passed away, which led her to neglect the business somewhat and so the sales declined. But now, motivated by the need to continue supporting her family, she has started the work again and wants to strengthen her business.

This is why she is asking for the loan to buy supplies wholesale (vegetables, cornflour, chicken, fizzy drinks) and a large umbrella. This will help her to improve the business's image and she will also be able to produce more food to sell to her customers and satisfy their tastes. Thus she will be able to improve her income so she can continue to look after her family's wellbeing. 

Following her father's example, Natalia just wants to carry on providing for the family and so she works hard to achieve this. In the near future she hopes to expand her business to make it more profitable and so improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies wholesale (vegetables, cornflour, chicken, fizzy drinks) and a large umbrella.

loans.name: Shaukat

texts.en:
Shaukat is the age of 49, living in Lahore with his spouse and four children. He has been running a barber shop for many years. He provides services for hair cutting, hair color, groom makeover, shaving etc. Mostly on holidays, the customers come for hair cutting. Due to rush, sometimes he feels difficulties due to bad sitting arrangements. He does not have a proper place for new customers who are waiting. This is the reason he wants to furnish his barber shop so his customers can wait their turn calmly.

Due to his low savings, Shaukat has requested a loan to furnish his shop and to buy additional equipment (hair steamer machine). His dream is to convert his barber shop into a salon, so he can attract more customers for his services.

Shaukat is providing services to one of his customer in the given picture. He is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to furnish his barber shop and to buy a hair steamer.

loans.name: Dilshad

texts.en:
Dilshad is a 26-year-old married man. He requests a second loan from BRAC; he invested his previous loan into his current enterprise. He is a young and energetic person who lives in Lahore, Pakistan with his family.

Dilshad operates a lace selling shop which is the only source of income for the family. Many tailors and the ladies of his town like to buy lace from his shop. His customers appreciate his lace collection. He is interested in purchasing a variety of the latest and expensive laces to enhance his income, but finds it difficult due to financial constrains. He has requested a loan amount from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help him to grow his lace selling business but will increase his net income and savings as well. 

He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy expensive and stylish laces to sell.

loans.name: Soyol-Erdene

texts.en:
Mrs. Soyol-Erdene lives with her mother and younger brother in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a nurse at a medical center for two years.

She is now requesting a loan of 1,200,000 MNT to buy fiberglass and foam for ger insulation. After insulation is installed, her family will live in a warm place where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released into the air. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy insulation materials

loans.name: Azul Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank, “Azul” meaning “Blue” is located in the rural town of Chuicabit in the state of Quetzaltenango, Guatemala. A year ago, this group received a new one year loan from Friendship Bridge financed by KIVA investors. Happily, they have successfully paid back their loan completely and are now requesting for a new one.

There are four new members who have recently joined the group for this loan cycle. Benita is one of them. She is 41 years of age and has six children, who range in age from eight to fourteen years old. Benita is a widow and works hard to meet the basic needs of her children. She understands the importance of nutritious food and healthy habits. Like 88% of the women in her Trust Bank, she never attended school but she is keenly aware of the importance of education. Benita understands that she is investing in the successful future of each of her children, knowing that their lives will be different because of the opportunities that she is working hard to give them. All six of her children are in primary school and she has high hopes that they will continue further.

Benita is a hard-working business woman. She sells vegetables in her community market and raises chickens to sell as well. But, Benita has a clear vision of growing her business and having additional income. For this reason, she is currently requesting her first loan with Friendship Bridge. Benita will use the funds to start a new agricultural business. She will buy flower seeds as well as seeds to grow peas. She will also purchase fertilizer. Finally, Benita plans to buy more chickens to raise and sell.

She shares with much astonishment, "It is amazing to know that many people around the world want to know my story and the story of the Trust Bank so they can support us through microloans. I like being part of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Azul”. We have such a great opportunity to share and know each other a bit more in our monthly meetings. We appreciate the trainings in various topics like effective business practices, indebtedness, nutrition, healthy habits and self-esteem. We understand how important it is to acquire more knowledge about these subjects. Thank you, KIVA investors, for this wonderful opportunity!”

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant flowers and peas, as well as fertilizer and chickens

loans.name: Catalinas Group

texts.en:
Santa Catarina Palopo, is known as the “blue town” because of the rich and beautiful color of the traditional textiles worn there. It is full of friendly and hardworking women, men and children. It is one of the smaller towns in the department of Sololá in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. The women of Santa Catarina work in various businesses including textile production, weaving and small businesses like mini bookstores and shops for the sale of items for daily consumption.

Several years ago, a group of women united together and formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Catalinas” meaning “women of Santa Catarina. Currently, there are eight women in the group with the goal of creating their own solutions as successful entrepreneurs thereby overcoming poverty.

Lidia is a 27 year old married woman with four children, who range in age from four to twelve years old. Although she only had one year of formal education, Lidia is keenly aware that her children need to have as much education as possible so that they can enjoy a successful future. This is a common desire among the clients of Friendship Bridge. Her oldest child will start the 7th grade next year while the others will continue in elementary school. Lidia is an enterprising woman who decided two years ago to start a bookstore business located in a small room of her own house. She lives right in the center of Santa Catarina Palopo and there is a lot of foot traffic past her business. Lidia is applying for a new loan with Friendship Bridge as she needs more financial capital for her business. She will use the funds to purchase inventory for her bookstore, especially various types and sizes of notebooks, books and other school supplies. Lidia wants to be well-prepared to have the necessary school supplies so that when parents visit her shop at the beginning of the year, her store will be fully stocked.

All of the women of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Catalinas” send an affectionate greeting to KIVA investors during this holiday season. They hope that the New Year is full of blessings and good health for all.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, books and other school supplies to sell

loans.name: Dúo Pachali Group

texts.es: Dúo Pachali,Lubia de 37 años, casada y tiene 3 hijos, su esposo se dedica a la jardinería, Lubia se dedica a la venta de lencería y ropa de niños, ambulantemente, sus lugares de ventas son en las aldeas cercanas, como chixoles, el Manzanillo y san Lucas, también la buscan en su casa, lleva 5 años y espera poder agrandar el negocio y con las ganancias poder mejorar su casa,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de lenceria para la venta es su segundo credito que solicita a kiva esta muy agradecida con Dios y kiva por ayudarla en su negocio de ante mano les agradese y que Dios los bendiga.
texts.en:
Lubia is a member of the Dúo Pachali group. She is 37 years old and married with 3 children. Her husband works as a gardener.

Lubia works as a street vendor selling lingerie and clothing for children. She sells at nearby villages such as Chixoles, Manzanillo and San Lucas, and also from her home. She has been doing this for 5 years and she hopes to be able to expand her business along with her earnings in order to improve her home. 

She is asking for this loan in order to buy lingerie to sell. This is her second loan from Kiva and she is grateful to God and Kiva for helping her with her business and offers thanks in advance and she hopes that God will bless you.

loans.use: to buy lingerie and children's clothing to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras De Chichi Group

texts.es:
La señora Tomasa es casada. Tiene 53 años de edad. No tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar. Tiene 1 hijo que no esta estudiando. Se dedica a su tienda de artículos de consumo diario. Inició este negocio con la ayuda de su esposo y a la fecha lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para ampliar su capital de trabajo comprando artículos para surtir su tienda. Desea en el futuro contar con más capital de trabajo y desea tener una abarrotería.

Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio y artesania.
texts.en:
Tomasa is married and is fifty-three years old.  She did not have the opportunity to attend school.  She has one son who is not studying.  

She has a general store that she began ten years ago with the help of her husband.  She organized a group and is requesting a loan that she will use to grow her working capital by buying items to stock her business.  She hopes that she will have more working capital and an established grocery store in the future.  

The other group members make a living in business and crafts.

loans.use: to buy everyday products for her store.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en: Perlita is a merchant from Bohol, Philippines. She has been running a sari-sari or convenience store for more than 20 years. This is her only source of income. Perlita wants to expand her business but lacks the financial resources to do so. Because of this, she is asking for a loan to buy additional merchandise to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, snack foods, and other items. With this, she will be able to improve the variety of her inventory, thus attracting more clients in her store. In the future, Perlita hopes her business continues to be successful.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, snack foods, and other items

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is a married woman with five children from Talibon, Bohol.  She earns a living through retail sales of charcoal.  Her husband earns an income through a motorcycle transport business. 

Annabelle is asking for a loan to pay for the repair of a motorcycle and to pay for school fees. In the future, Annabelle hopes of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to continue supporting her children's education.

loans.use: to help her husband pay for the repair of a motorcycle and to pay for school fees

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
This is Remedios. She is 54, married to Jose, and mother to her children. She is a resident of Tondo, Manila, Philippines. Together with her husband, Remedios operates a school and office supply business where she sells supplies such as pens, bond paper, construction paper and other items. She works hard to continually provide income for her family’s everyday expenses. Remedios gets supplies at wholesale prices and sells them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house and her regular customers are her neighbors and local community members. Remedios earns a minimum of 500 PHP each day. 

Remedios is requesting a 42,000 PHP loan to buy office supplies, expand her product inventory and continue operating her business. In the future she hopes to be a wholesaler supplier of school and office supplies and dreams of having a better living. Remedios meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy school and office supplies

loans.name: Marolyn

texts.en: Marolyn is 40 years old and has one child, who is in school. Marolyn is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Marolyn has requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pig. Marolyn has been doing her business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Marolyn would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pig

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is 45 years old and is married with three children. Myrna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell dry goods and beauty products business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell. Myrna has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell dry goods and beauty products business for 23 years and also earns an income from raising pigs. Myrna aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: As a married parent of six children, Nenita works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice grains. Nenita is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of household goods to sell such as canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, shampoo etc for her general store business. Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household goods to sell such as canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, shampoo etc

loans.name: Babylou

texts.en: Babylou works hard to support her family. Babylou is married and has a buy-and-sell frozen foods business in the Philippines. Babylou has requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like tocino, hotdogs, etc. to sell. Babylou has been in this business for 5 years now. In the future, Babylou would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like tocino, hotdogs etc to sell

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Nelia works hard to support her family.

She has a repair shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store and raising pigs. Nelia is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her repair shop.

Nelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her repair shop

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Lida works hard to support her family.

She has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Lida is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy raw materials for her nipa roofing business.

Lida has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her nipa roofing business.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 51 years old and married with three children. Letecia works hard to provide for her family. 

Letecia runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more items such as soft drinks, sardines and other groceries.

Before this, Letecia has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from E-loading (mobile prepaid load).

Letecia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as soft drinks, sardines and other groceries

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mila is 40 years old and has 4 children who are in school.

Mila has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Mila requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for her tailoring business.

Mila has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Mila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her tailoring business

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en:
Prescila is 59 years old and married with five children.

Prescila works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

Prescila has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 55 years old and married with six children.

Yolanda works hard to provide for her family. She sells charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Yolanda has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running charcoal business for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Yolanda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Danila

texts.en:
Danila is 34 years old with one child who is in school, Danila works very hard to provide for her family.

Danila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like rice, soap, sugar, eggs, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell .

Danila has been in this business for 3 years. In the future Danila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like rice, soap, sugar, eggs, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 58-years-old and married with three children.

Nelia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Nelia has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Nelia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ruby Rose

texts.en:
Ruby Rosa is 34 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. Ruby Rosa works very hard to provide for them.

Ruby Rosa runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan 9,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Ruby Rosa has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soap, snack foods and other groceries.

In the future Ruby Rosa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sanatan

texts.en:
Sanatan is 39 years old and is a differently able man living with his wife and two children. Both of his children attend the local school while he runs a poultry farm. When he was younger, Sanatan worked in a machine shop in Bangalore, a large city in the adjacent state. The work was dangerous and he lost his left hand. After this, it was very difficult to find work, so he returned home. 

Three years ago, he started running his poultry farm, which he can do despite his disability. It has helped bring a steady income for his family. From this activity he earns 8,000 INR per month. However, this is not enough for his monthly household expenses and he would like to be able to better provide for his family.

Thus, he has been saving to expand his farm. So far, he has saved 50,000 INR from over the last three years  and he is asking a loan amounting 40,000 INR to complete the money he needs to renovate his poultry farm. The total expense of 90,000 INR will be used for the reconstruction of a poultry farm wall, a sheet roof and an automatic water supply.

loans.use: To pay for the reconstruction of a poultry farm wall, a sheet roof and an automatic water supply.

loans.name: Urmila

texts.en:
Urmila is a 39-year-old, unmarried woman living with her two younger sisters in a village in Odisha, a state in Eastern India. Together, they all make bags from paper and also run a small shop selling fresh bodi and papad, which are traditional spicy snacks made from ground wheat and lentils. They also make paper carry-bags that they sell to other business owners in their village. The sisters make enough to get by on but still struggle to meet monthly expenses, as they are all unmarried and must support themselves.

Urmila is therefore asking for a loan of 15,000 INR so she can begin to purchase items in bulk and expand the business. Particularly, items like flour, salt, and oil will be much cheaper in large amounts and she will be able to earn a larger profit. She hopes to build up the business into one of the main bodi shops in town, while continuing to bring in income from the paper bags.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing of items like flour, salt, oil, and spices for her snacks business.

loans.name: Sitansu

texts.en:
Sitansu is a 19-year-old man with a hearing impediment. He lives with his parents and younger brother in Odisha, a state in Eastern India. After finishing school, he undertook training in mobile repairing so he could help support his family. As the oldest son, it is his duty to support his father and help his younger brother through school.

Even though he is young, he has become quite experienced in repairing mobiles, and he has purchased a computer for downloading software, along with other tools. He also has a stock of mobile phones for sale in his shop. 

However, he dreams of having a much bigger shop that will allow him to strengthen his family income and support his parents when they age, and someday also help him provide for a family of his own. 

Sitansu is now asking for a 30,000 INR loan that he will use to buy additional tools and invest in more mobile devices for sale.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing of additional tools and investing in more mobile devices for sale.

loans.name: Álvaro Antonio

texts.es:
Álvaro es una persona de 42 años de edad, quien realizo sus estudios de educación básica, luego para continuar sus estudios de educación media se vio en la necesidad de migrar a la ciudad y continuar una carrera técnica en mecánica automotriz, en la actualidad es técnico Mecánico responsable de la maquinaria con la que cuenta la fabrica donde él trabaja. 

Álvaro posee una familia formada por su esposa y sus dos hijos, su esposa es cosmetologa y sus hijos están estudiando en una escuela publica en la ciudad. Álvaro junto a su esposa trabajan arduamente, por darles lo mejor a sus dos hijos y darles la educación hasta que se puedan graduar profesionalmente.
 

Actualmente, Álvaro es empleado en una fabrica, que esta ubicada en la misma colonia en la cual reside y trabaja desde hace 11 años. Manifiesta que desde niño le gustaba mucho jugar con carros de juguete  y poco a poco fue adquiriendo conocimiento sobre vehículos, motivo por el cual opto estudiar una carrera relacionada con dichas maquinarias, lo cual lo ha convertido en una persona de bien, poniendo en practica los principios morales que en su familia se le fueron inculcados.


El dinero sera utilizado para complementar un monto para comprar un terreno en el cual planea construir su casa, de esta manera mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia; ya que les garantizara el derecho a una vivienda digna a su familia.

El señor Álvaro tiene proyecciones a un futuro de tener su propio taller de reparaciones de vehículos, y piensa involucrar a sus dos hijos ya que a pesar de su corta edad, ya muestran interés por aprender el oficio de la mecánica automotriz y el señor Álvaro manifiesta que hará todo lo posible por ayudar a sus hijos a estudiar las carreras que ellos prefieran.
texts.en:
Álvaro is forty-two years old.  He completed his primary education and then moved to the city in order to continue with his secondary education, focusing on a career as an automotive mechanic.  He is currently a mechanical technician responsible for the machinery at the factory where he works. 

Álvaro's family includes his wife and their two children.  His wife is a cosmetologist and his children are studying at a public school in the city.  Together with his wife, he works tirelessly in order to give the best to his two children.  He strives to provide them with the means to go to school so that they can graduate as professionals.  
 
Presently, Álvaro works at a factory that is located in the same town where he lives.  He has been working there for eleven years.  He says that he has liked cars since he was a young boy and that little by little, he learned more and more about vehicles.  For this reason, he decided to study a career related to this type of machinery.  His career has made him into a good person; he always puts his morals into practice.

The financing will be added to the amount that he has already saved in order to buy land.  He hopes to build his house on this plot of land, thereby improving the quality of life for his family.  He has already guaranteed his family the right to a dignified home. 

Álvaro has dreams for the future.  He wants to have his won vehicle repair workshop and is thinking of involving his two children who, despite their young age, already have shown an interest in learning the automotive mechanic trade.  Álvaro says that he will do everything possible to help his two children study the career paths that they want.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Justiniano

texts.es: Justiniano, tiene 33 años de edad, es soltero, vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. El trabajó por varios años en una empresa privada. y en busca de obtener ingresos decidió poner su propio negocio de una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar, vende pan, manteca, azúcar, harina, arroz, frijoles, embutidos, quesos, churros, dulces y refrescos. Ha solicitado un préstamo de 15,000 Lempiras para surtir mas su negocio con productos como arroz, azúcar, manteca, frijoles, pan, huevos, leche, queso, embutidos, pastas, productos de aseo, churros y refrescos. Su plan es aumentar las ventas para obtener mejores ingresos y mejorar su casa y poder tener una familia.
texts.en:
Justiniano, 33, is single and lives in the town of Choloma, Cortes. For several years, he has worked at a private business. In the hopes of earning a better income, he decided to open his own grocery store business where he sells basic necessity products. He sells bread, butter, sugar, flour, rice, beans, cold cuts, cheese, donuts, sweets, and drinks.

He is requesting this loan of 15,000 HNL to stock up his business with products such as rice, sugar, butter, beans, bread, eggs, milk, cheese, cold cuts, pasta, cleaning products, donuts, and drinks. His plan is to increase sales to earn a better income and improve his home, and to be ale to have a family.

loans.use: to stock up his business with products such as rice, sugar, butter, beans, bread, eggs, milk, cheese, cold cuts, pasta, cleaning products, donuts, and drinks.

loans.name: Jenniffer Magaly

texts.es:
Jenneffer, es casada, tiene un hijo, no posee ayuda del extranjero, con el fin de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar instalo una tienda en su casa de habitación en la que ofrece productos de primera necesidad, ya tiene 4 años de tenerla, la atiende de 5:00 a.m. hasta las 7:00 p.m., no ha tenido ninguna dificultad que le dificulte atenderla.
Invertirá en la compra de pollo, azúcar, sal, arroz, bebidas, entre otros productos necesarios para cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes, espera aumentar sus ventas, mejorar su inventario, incrementar sus ingresos y seguir apoyando con los gastos familiares.
Sueña con tener un negocio más amplio  y darle a sus hijos una buena formación academica.
texts.en:
Jenneffer is married, has one son, and does not receive help from any relatives living abroad.  With the hope of helping her husband with the family expenses, she set up a store in her home where she offers basic needs products.  She has been running this business for four years and attends to her customers from 5:00am until 7:00pm.  She has not had any problems that make it very difficult for her to run the store. 

She will invest in the purchase of chicken, sugar, salt, rice, drinks, and other necessary products so that she can cover the needs of her customers.  She hopes to grow her sales, improve her inventory, increase her income, and continue contributing to the family expenses.

She dreams of having a larger business and of giving her son a good education.

loans.use: to buy chicken, sugar, salt, rice, drinks, and other items.

loans.name: Kulpunai

texts.ru: Кулпунай 33 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 сыновей. Дети учатся в школе. У Кулпунай - среднее образование, по характеру очень доброжелательная. В деловых отношениях проявляет терпение и пунктуальность. Ее старания в работе и стремление к улучшению условий жизни в своем доме, говорит о ее целеустремленности. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Кулпунай занимается животноводством, стартовав 12 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Кулпунай, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 нетель. За период ведения бизнеса, Кулпунай значительно улучшила свои жилищные условия. Ежемесячный доход составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кулпунай обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку нетелей для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Кулпунай планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Kulpunai is 33 years old and she is married with three children who are in school.  Kulpunai has a high school education and she is a very friendly woman.  She is patient and punctual in her business relations.  Her efforts at work and dedication speak to her desire to improve her family's living conditions.  As the main source of income for her family, Kulpunai raises livestock, which she started doing 12 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 15,000 som KGS.  Thanks to her hard work, she now has one dairy cow and one heifer on her farm.  In the course of running her business, Kulpunai has improved her family's living situation considerably.  Her monthly income is 20,000 som (KGS).  With the goal of developing her business further, she has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan to buy heifers so she can increase her head of livestock.  Kulpunai plans to use the income from the loan to further increase her head of livestock, as well as to save up money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy heifers

loans.name: Parbati

texts.en:
Parbati is a 33-year-old divorcé who lives in her father’s house with her 13-year-old daughter. 

For the past five years she has run a grocery shop and tailoring business out of a sheet metal structure that she has set up near the house. Her shop is always well stocked with vegetables, cosmetics, bangles, and items for her tailoring business, such as thread and various colored cloths. 

She dreams of having a big, formal shop that’s filled with all of the grocery and cosmetic items the women in her village want, along with an expanded tailoring business. She wants to use her loan to buy more of the necessary items, specifically bracelets, prepackaged food, and face creams. She would also like to buy more high-quality cloth to use for her tailoring. 

With the additional income, Parbati hopes to be able to pay for her daughter to have a good education.

loans.use: To expand her grocery shop and tailoring business by purchasing vegetables, bangles and high quality cloth.

loans.name: Niranjana

texts.en:
Niranjana is a 37-year-old differently able man living with his wife and four children, three daughters and one son. To support his family, he has opened a variety shop out of a thatched building he built on the side of the road that runs along the damn by his house. In the shop, he sells biscuits and other packaged foods, in addition to household items such as soap, detergent, and lotion. The area gets good traffic and consistent customer flow. 

He dreams of one day opening a restaurant, but he understands he has to build up to that point by gaining more experience and saving money. For now, he is asking for a loan of 20,000 INR to update his shop with more modern furnishings. Specifically, he wants to buy a refrigerator for cold drinks and other perishable items and to build a showcase for stacking the food for the customers to see. He will also purchase additional items such as more packaged foods that are in high demand. He hopes this growth will increase his profits and help him raise the standard of living for his family.

loans.use: To pay for a refrigerator for cold drinks and other perishable items and for building a showcase for stacking the food for his general store.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is married and has four children. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. 

Juliana is taking a loan of $1,000 (USD) to improve her business. She will use this loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as fish, oil, bread, cigarettes, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, sagiko, noodles, books, pencils, water and slippers. 

Juliana opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital $500. She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fish, oil, bread, cigarettes, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, sagiko, noodles, books, pencils, water and slippers

loans.name: Madalena

texts.en:
Madalena is applying for a loan of $1000 to buy items for her general store. She is married and this is her first loan. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as noodles, cigarettes, fish, coffee, sugar, oils, candles and shampoo .
Madalena opened her kiosk in 2006 with her own working capital of $250. She is earning a good income and she will use the income to support her family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy noodles, cigarettes, fish, coffee, sugar, oils, candles and shampoo

loans.name: Barchinoy

texts.en:
Barchinoy, born in 1963, is a hardworking, married woman with 4 children from Tajikistan. She is a smart woman and provides for the well being of her family. She has been in the animal husbandry business for more than 10 years. She has great experience and the ability to be successful in business.  Barchinoy wants to increase her working capital and asks for a loan of 3,000 TJS to buy cattle. 

She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle to increase her working capital

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
Nasiba was born in 1988. She is divorced and has a child. Her child is two years old. Nasiba has a higher degree of Lawyer. 

Nasiba works in a shop as a shop assistant. She works hard to earn for living. She is the only breadwinner of her child. Little by little, Nasiba improves her living conditions. 

She is going to buy furniture for her household, but she does not have enough savings. She is asking for a loan of TJS 5,000 (somoni) to buy furniture. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her household.

loans.name: Yuliana Aide

texts.es:
Yuliana Aide tiene 22 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Morrropon conocida como la Capital del Tondero, su población se dedicada a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería que pertenece a la Provincia de del mismo nombre, ubicado en la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella alquila su mototaxi para servicio de transporte público, es una madre emprendedora, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos de su mototaxi y de esta manera seguir alquilando su vehículo y generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Yuliana Aide, 22, lives with her husband and kids in the Morropon district, known as the home of tondero music.  People in this area work in farming, selling products, and raising livestock.  The district is located in the province of the same name in the Piura region of the north coast of Peru.

Yuliana Aide rents her motorcycle taxi to provide a public transportation service.  She is an enterprising mom.  Yuliana Aide has requested a loan of 1,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to buy parts for her motorcycle taxi so she can continue renting the vehicle and generating more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy parts for her vehicle

loans.name: Hermogenes

texts.en: Hermogenes is an industrious farmer. His work is very difficult but he is determined to continue and improve his business. He asks for a 12,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer and seeds and pay labor costs. He wants his crops to grow well and earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Derick

texts.en:
Derick is 38-year-old man who deals in supplying eggs. He owns a retail shop in Mariakani, Kenya. He is a married father of three, whose spouse is a housewife and he has been in this business for the last three years, doing well.

This marks his fifth borrowing, after successfully repaying his previous loan. Derick will use the money to purchase trays of eggs, cooking fat, and sacks of sugar for his shop. 

The anticipated profit will be used to service his loan and to expand his retail shop business. He hopes to own a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase trays of eggs, cooking fat, and sacks of sugar for his shop.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a variety store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending and raising hogs.  Grace requests a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional soft-drinks and other groceries to sell in her variety store.

Grace has sustained her business activities with five  previous loans from NWTF and Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional soft-drinks and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena is 44 years old and married, with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc.

Ma. Elena has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and she also earns an income from raising pigs.

Ma. Elena aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Marison

texts.en:
Marison works hard to support her family. She is married and has a manicure and pedicure services business in the Philippines. Marison has been in this business for five years now. 

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items for her business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items for her manicure and pedicure business

loans.name: José Norberto

texts.es:
José es un campesino de 52 años de edad, casado y padre de 3 hijos por quienes trabaja incansablemente para sacarlos adelante.
Aprendió el oficio de agricultor gracias a las enseñanzas que su padre le transmitió desde pequeño; esto le ha dado la posibilidad de aprovechar los conocimientos adquiridos para hacer uso de ellos y explotar la tierra que posee, allí tiene cultivos de café con 10.000 palos en producción, cultivos de plátano, árboles frutales y además tiene 3 hectáreas con sembrados de caña, la cual transforma en panela desde un trapiche que es propiedad de un amigo; de esta forma ha generado los recursos suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares y del hogar.
Actualmente solicita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas (abonos, pesticidas, larvicidas, fertilizantes), que requiere para reabonar su cultivo de café y así hacer más productiva la cosecha para tener la posibilidad de venderla a un mejor precio en el mercado y generar un mayor nivel de utilidades, lo que le permitirá reinvertir en su actividad agrícola que se ha convertido en su única fuente de ingresos.
José, como todo agricultor sueña con ampliar sus cultivos, especialmente el de café y caña de azúcar, así podrá aumentar la rentabilidad del negocio y estará en la capacidad de dar a sus hijos una educación universitaria de buena calidad y mejorará las condiciones de vida de todo el grupo familiar.
texts.en:
José is a married 52-year-old farmer. He has three children, and he works tirelessly to help them get ahead. José learned how to be a farmer thanks to his father, who taught him agriculture from a young age. José was able to take advantage of this knowledge in order to make use of the land he owns. He has coffee crops, with 10,000 plants in production, banana trees and fruit trees. He also has three hectares planted with sugar cane, which he transforms into brown sugar using a mill that belongs to a friend. With these activities, José has generated enough income to cover the expenses for his family and his household. 

José is currently requesting this loan in order to buy agricultural inputs (fertilizers, pesticides, larvicides and manure), which he needs in order to refertilize his coffee crops. This will make his harvest more productive and make it possible to sell the crops at a better price in the market, and generate a higher level of profits. José will be able to reinvest in his agricultural work, which has become his only source of income.

José, like all farmers, dreams of increasing his harvests, especially for his coffee and sugar cane crops. This would let him increase the profitability of his business and put him in a position to give his children a high-quality university education. It would also improve the living conditions of his whole family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, such as manure, fertilizers, pesticides and larvicides.

loans.name: Venera

texts.en:
Venera and her husband live in the town of Masis. The couple runs a small farm with 6 chickens and  grows greens. After 8 years of operating a farm, they were able to have a sustainable farm which helps them to meet their daily costs. Realizing how important agricultural income is, Venera has applied for this loan to renovate the barn. This will help her to keep livestock  and enlarge her farm. 

This is Venera's first loan; it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who previously didn’t have access to credit products because they have no credit history. This loan is very important for Venera and her husband because they will be able to enlarge their farm and increase their income.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the barn

loans.name: Miradija

texts.en:
Miradija is a 49-year-old mother of four children, two boys and two girls, all of whom are adults now. They are still all living together in an Ashkali community of Kosovo. 

Unemployment is high in these communities and she is fortunate that her husband is a taxi driver in his area, but he still doesn't earn enough to take care of all of the family expenses they have monthly. As a way to remedy this problem and ease some of their difficulties, Miradija and her husband have decided to start a new business. Working together as partners, they will sell used technical equipment that they will purchase in some of the bigger western European countries such as Germany. These products will include, but are not limited to, televisions, freezers, fax machines, scanners and even tires. For this reason she applied for a 2,000 EUR loan in order to buy technical equipment.

They will then sell this used equipment in a local market at a higher price to make a profit on each item.  Since they are able to purchase these things at a low price, they believe that this business will be successful and Miradija is very happy that her first job and work experience will be as a business partner with her husband, which leads her to feel confident and secure about their decision.

loans.use: To buy used technical equipment like televisions, freezers, fax machines, scanners, and even tires

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer De Arenal Group

texts.es:
La señora Marta de estado civil casada. curso 1 año de educación primaria. Tiene 2 hijos y 1 de ellos está estudiando. Se dedica a la elaboracion de miel. Inició este negocio con un pequeño capital que le concediera su esposo y a la fecha lleva 4 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de azucar para la elaboracion de miel. Desea en el futuro tener un capital mas grande para poder producir por mayor y poder exportar su producto. 

Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio y actividades pecuarias.

En la foto aparecen 10 integrantes, pero, solo a 6 de ellas se le concedió el préstamo.
texts.en:
Marta is married and completed one year of primary school.  She has two children and one of them is studying in school.  She earns a living making honey.  She began this business with a little capital from her husband, and she currently has four years of experience.

She organized a small group and is requesting a loan that she will use to buy sugar for making honey.  She hopes to have more capital in the future, which will allow her to produce more honey, sell it wholesale, and to export her final products.

The other group members make a living in trade and in activities related to livestock.  There are ten members in the photo; six of these group members will utilize the funds from the loan.

loans.use: to buy sugar for making honey.

loans.name: Tsedendorj

texts.en:
Tsedendorj is 52 years old. He lives with his wife, daughter and son in Kherlen, an easternmost town in Mongolia. Tsedendorj has a disability and gets a state pension. His wife and daughter work at a milk factory and his son transports diary products to the capital city to sell. Tsedendorj’s family house has deteriorated over the years and needs some serious repair.

Tsedendorj is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to buy vacuum-insulated windows, hardwood floors, shingles, fiberglass and foam to renovate his house. He will use his loan to create a comfortable and warm place for his family to live. Less coal will be burned and fewer pollutants released into air.

loans.use: to renovate his house

loans.name: Munkhnaran

texts.en: Mrs. Munkhnaran is 27 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in Kherlen, the easternmost town in Mongolia. She has been working as a product developer in a business center since May, 2013. Her husband sells vegetables at a grocery store and earns in proportion to his sales. Her elder daughter studies at elementary school and younger daughter goes to kindergarten. She and her husband recently decided to open a tire repair shop and for this cause she is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to buy necessary equipment such as a tire changer, wheel balancing machine and tire spreader. This new business will greatly improve her family's living standard if implemented successfully.

loans.use: to buy tire repair equipment

loans.name: Zulaa

texts.en:
Zulaa is 48 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Darkhan, the third largest city of Mongolia. Since 2009, she has been working as a container polisher at a private firm. Zulaa’s husband is currently unemployed and stays at home. Their children all go to high school. 

Zulaa is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to buy an electric car to start a taxi service. The advantage of an electric car is that it contributes to cleaner air because it emits less pollutants into air and wastes less fuel. Her car will be used by her husband to start a taxi service.

loans.use: to buy an electric car

loans.name: Nieve Jesús

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Jesús De Nazaret. 
En este lugar vive la señora Nieve, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos de 18, 16, 15, 12, 11 Y 9 años de edad, 4 estudian en colegio y los menores en  escuela. Su esposo es mecánico.
Doña Nieve con la finalidad de ganar algo por su cuenta desde hace 5 años arrendo un local en una avenida muy concurrida de la ciudad en la cual vende comidas rápidas como hamburguesas, papas fritas, sodas, jugos y batidos de frutas, entre otras cosas, con ella trabajan dos personas más a quienes les paga un sueldo por su trabajo. Le encanta su trabajo ya que además de ganar algo por su cuenta también ayuda a que las personas que trabajan con ella puedan ganarse algo por el bien de sus familias.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar víveres para preparar los alimentos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 3 ciclos  y le gusta la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un local propio ya que el pago de arriendos se le lleva gran parte de sus ganancias.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, the members of the Jesús de Nazaret communal bank meet every fifteen days. This city has been known for many years as the city of the true tamarindos, due to the large quantity of this type of fruit that there was here.

Nieve, 34, lives here. She is married and has six children ages 18, 16, 15, 12, 11, and 9. Four of these children are in high school and the younger ones are in primary school. Her husband is a mechanic.

With the goal of earning something on her own, Nieve rented out a space on a busy street in the city five years ago to sell fast food such as hamburgers, french fries, soda, juice and fruit smoothies among other things. Two people work with her, whom she pays a salary. She loves her job because in addition to earning her own income, she also helps the people who work for her so they can earn money for their own families.

She will use this loan to buy supplies for making food. She has been with this communal bank for three loan cycles and she likes the help that the loans provide. Her dream is to have her own space because she now pays rent, which takes up a large portion of her profits.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Deicy Candelaria

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Jesús De Nazaret. 
En este lugar vive la señora Deicy, tiene 34 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 11 y 8 años los mismos que estudian en escuela. El marido es comerciante. 
Doña Deicy junto al esposo tienen un negocio de venta de comida, todos los días instalan un pequeño local en las afueras de una institución pública lugar por el cual  pasan muchas personas que se sirven sus deliciosos platos, ellos solo venden desayunos y en ciertos días almuerzos también, son dos años que tienen este negocio el cual les permite salir adelante y darles lo necesario a sus hijos de una manera honrada.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar víveres para preparar los alimentos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 3 ciclos  y le gusta la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un buen restaurante.
texts.en:
The "Jesús De Nazaret" communal bank meets every fortnight in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí. This city has been known for many years now as the city of the Royal Tamarinds, for the great amount of this fruit that grows in this season.

Deicy lives here. She is 34 years old. She lives in a common-law relationship from which she has two children aged 8 and 11, who attend school. Her husband is a businessman. Deicy along with her husband run a business selling food. Every day they set up outside of a public institution. There are a lot of people passing and they sell their delicious meals. They only sell breakfast and on certain days also do lunch. They have had this business for two years. It allows them to get ahead and provide for their children in an honorable manner. 

Deicy will use this loan to buy supplies to make the meals. She has been a member of this communal bank for three loan cycles and she likes the support from the loans. Her dream is to own a good restaurant.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is a married woman with six children. She is from Getafe, Bohol. For more than ten years, Virgilia and her husband have operated a fishing business. This is their main source of income.

Virgilia is requesting a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other supplies. She will use her loan to improve their catch to have more fish to sell in the market. Virgilia hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and supplies

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. This is the source of her income.

Josefina is requesting a loan for additional capital for her business. With a loan, she will buy more stock to sell like canned goods, rice, candies, cookies, shampoos, soaps, toothpaste and others.  Josefina hopes of expanding her business and being a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, rice, candies, cookies, shampoos, soaps, toothpaste and others

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has a nine-year-old son. She is engaged in a rice-farming business with her husband.

Lydia is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, to pay for labor, and to pay for school fees. With this assistance, she hopes to be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her harvest and yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, to pay for labor, and to pay for school fees

loans.name: Ma. Erlinda

texts.en:
Ma. Erlinda is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in rice farming for several years now. 

Ma. Erlinda is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer and more rice seedlings. She will use her loan to improve the productivity of her farm thus augmenting her yield and income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seedlings

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 60 years old and widowed with one kid. For the past ten years, she has been running a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from fattening pigs. Merlyn works hard to provide for her family.

Merlyn is requesting a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, she aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Ana May

texts.en:
Ana May is 29 years old and married with three children in school. For the past four years, she has been running a general store in the Philippines. Ana May works very hard to provide for her family.

Ana May is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks such as soft drinks, rice, sugar, eggs, noodles, and other items to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, rice, sugar, eggs, noodles, and other items

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Maricar works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming rice. Maricar is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Maricar has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina works hard to support her family. Divina is married and has a sound system business in the Philippines.

Divina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional lights and other equipment for the maintenance of her sound system.

Divina has been in this business for 16 years now, and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Divina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional lights and othe equipment for the maintenance of her sound system

loans.name: Loyda Raquel

texts.es:
Loyda, es casada, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos de 16, 10 y 6 años de edad, los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a vender material escolar, productos de belleza, entre otro tipo de productos. Es un negocio que emprendió por iniciativa propia hace ya 11 años, lo atiende de 7:00 a.m. hasta las 5:00 p.m. 
Invertirá en la compra de material didáctico, canastas navideñas, lociones, cremas, etc., para dar más opciones de compra a sus clientes, espera atraer más clientes, aumentar sus ventas y mejorar su economía para cumplir con sus compromisos económicos y familiares.
Aspira tener un supermercado y trabajar con sus propias utilidades.
texts.en:
Loyda is married, and lives with her husband and three children, ages 16, 10, and 6 who attend school.  She sells school supplies, beauty products, and other types of products.  She started this business on her own 11 years ago and she works from 7:00 am to 5:00 pm.

She will buy school supplies, Christmas baskets, perfumes, creams, etc. so she can provide more options to her customers.  She expects to attract more customers, increase her sales, and improve her finances so she can meet her financial and family obligations.

She wants to have a grocery store and work on her own.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Carlos Fredis

texts.es:
Carlos, es un padre de familia que vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 4 y 8 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de huevos de gallina por mayor y desinfectantes, en sus inicios lo hacía junto a su primo, pero desde hace ya cinco años que se independizó, lo hace en un horario de 7:00 a.m. has las 5:00 p.m., dependiendo de cómo estén las ventas. 
Utilizara el préstamo para comprar huevos de gallina por mayor para luego distribuirlos con sus  clientes, espera cumplir con los encargos de su producto en menor tiempo, tener más clientes y aumentar sus ganancias.
 Aspira hacer crecer su negocio, dar su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Carlos is the father of a family who lives together with his wife and two children aged 4 and 8. He sells eggs wholesale and disinfectant. At first he worked with his cousin but five years ago he went out on his own. He works from 7 am until 5 pm depending on how sales are. He will use this loan to buy eggs wholesale, to later distribute them to his clients. He hopes to fill the orders for his product in less time, have more clients and increase his revenues. He hopes to expand his business and offer his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy eggs.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is 57-years-old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Dominga is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and pay for laborers' salaries for farm preparation.

Dominga has been farming rice for twenty years and also earns additional income from farming coconut and raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for laborers' salaries for farm preparation

loans.name: Raylen

texts.en:
Raylen is 42 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Raylen has a food vending business in the Philippines. Raylen has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Raylen has been in this business for two years. In the future, Raylen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Iryn

texts.en:
Iryn is 40 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, such as eggs, rice, charcoal, sugar, shampoo, and groceries.

Iryn has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from a restaurant.

Iryn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Les Scribes Group

texts.fr: Le client Raymond est un commerçant  et président du  collectif  d’affaires «Les scribes», entrepreneur, dynamique, âgé de 33 ans  et  célibataire. Le client est vendeur des produits d’alimentation. Elle installe sa marchandise dans une mini alimentation sur la route dans un Quartier animé, où, elle a su gagner sa clientèle.
